commit_message:
Refactor image uploader class structure

- Static methods are now class methods
- secure_registries and insecure_registries are now class attributes,
  so don't need to be passed as arguments for class methods
- The abstract class ImageUploader is gone, it wasn't adding value
  since all implementations extend BaseImageUploader
- The upload_image static method is now an instance method, and its
  only argument is an UploadTask object
- Values calculated in source_target_names are now calculated when the
  UploadTask is created

The result should be more maintainable and understandable. It should
now be easier to pass more values to upload_image without requiring
disruptive changes.

Change-Id: Iaf140bb473194876bcdaeac85fdddc1c0d96347d

commit_message:
Deprecate the ceilometer driver

Ceilometer should not be part of the n-odl project because it creates
some ugly dependencies with the ceilometer project which do not make
sense. The driver is marked as deprecated in Stein and will get removed
in the T cycle.

Change-Id: Ifb4f6cfda09f2bceac623b12466ecd4028a6b4c8
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

commit_message:
fs010: switch undercloud to podman

To iterate in podman testing, switch the fs010 to deploy an undercloud
with podman instead of docker, in master (stein) only.

blueprint podman-support
Change-Id: I7dd2ff456f5310735a61ee59a3e873af48260870

commit_message:
libvirt: Avoid setting MTU during live migration if unset

If there is a live migration of an instance that was launched
before change Iecc265fb25e88fa00a66f1fd38e215cad53e7669, it
would not have an mtu set and therefore it wouldn't have it in
the XML.

When live migrating, the mtu is added which changes the
guest ABI[1], causing the live migration to fail.  The failure
occurs when trying to live migrate an instance that:

- Launched before change Iecc265fb25e88fa00a66f1fd38e215cad53e7669
- It has not been rebooted (i.e. XML has not changed since)
- It's using bridge/tap networking
- Migration attempted after change Iecc265fb25e88fa00a66f1fd38e215cad53e7669

This patch prevents this by avoiding setting MTU if the running
instance does not have one configured in its domain XML.

[1]: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1449346

Closes-Bug #1800511
Change-Id: I6e2e6437a7c826dc425d8b353c38670d6eece0b5

used if an operator is performing a live, rolling upgrade.

commit_message:
Add nova-status upgrade check for consoles

This will check if a deployment is currently using consoles and warns
the operator to set [workarounds]enable_consoleauth = True on their
console proxy host if they are performing a rolling upgrade which is
not yet complete.

Partial-Bug: #1798188

Change-Id: Idd6079ce4038d6f19966e98bcc61422b61b3636b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-03 20:44:46.000000000', 'message': "Simplify logic in get_enforcer

The get_enforcer method is used by oslopolicy CLI scripts to generate
policy files. The scripts will use configuration files to find policy
files so that overrides can be generated with default values
registered in code. The get_enforcer method used to parse the
arguments passed in from the system and remove the `namespace` and
`output-file` arguments because they wouldn't be recognized while
processing configuration values.

This commit simplifies the logic of get_enforcer. A related
discussion was held in review:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530828/3

Proposing this to nova since I attempted to use similar logic to
fix a problem in keystone, but figured the simplified logic might be
useful here, too.

Change-Id: I7cd27fe8c39ddfc6ec20f4cfe4d62912d4cebaa4

commit_message:
Simplify logic in get_enforcer

The get_enforcer method is used by oslopolicy CLI scripts to generate
policy files. The scripts will use configuration files to find policy
files so that overrides can be generated with default values
registered in code. The get_enforcer method used to parse the
arguments passed in from the system and remove the `namespace` and
`output-file` arguments because they wouldn't be recognized while
processing configuration values.

This commit simplifies the logic of get_enforcer. A related
discussion was held in review:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/c/530828/3

Proposing this to nova since I attempted to use similar logic to
fix a problem in keystone, but figured the simplified logic might be
useful here, too.

Change-Id: I7cd27fe8c39ddfc6ec20f4cfe4d62912d4cebaa4

There is an issue with easy_install module as showed in
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/37296 that prevents
easy_install module to install pip in some distros. Changing to shell
module to fix this problem.

Change-Id: I1d469a685e59447bc2cad78031eeabd8f4fcd617
Closes-Bug: 1797931

commit_message:
Fix pip installation

We don't need to have pip installed with easy_install because virtualenv
will install their own pip locally.

Change-Id: I1d469a685e59447bc2cad78031eeabd8f4fcd617
Closes-Bug: 1797931

commit_message:
Change Swift storage directory to /srv/node/d1

So far Swift on the undercloud used /srv/node/1, while Swift deployed by
TripleO uses /srv/node/d1 as default. When moving to a containerized
undercloud, this needs to be adopted as well.

This requires updating the ring files as well as moving the directory.

Change-Id: I66e1600a121869d17cfdba86910944e718c774f6
(cherry picked from commit d2a27c6f0cd53eacccd938c107b11641485c294d)

commit_message:
Ensure unique containers names in docker-puppet

Use paunch as a library to not duplicate code around.
We'll need to add the logger once we have paunch 4.0.1
and rpm promoted with the recent logging fixes.

Closes-Bug: #1799573

Change-Id: I4386b155a4bdba430dc350914db7a6b6fdf92ac0
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2016-05-06 15:33:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-05-06 15:39:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-keystone-specs-docs http://logs.openstack.org/04/313604/1/check/gate-keystone-specs-docs/bb002ee/ : FAILURE in 2m 59s
- gate-keystone-specs-python27 http://logs.openstack.org/04/313604/1/check/gate-keystone-specs-python27/2cb8a33/ : FAILURE in 2m 11s'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2016-05-13 07:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2016-05-13 17:28:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I am not convinced we need new APIs.'}, {'account_id': 7191, 'date': '2016-05-13 22:25:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Not convinced by the need for this.

Even though you can add roles and federation direct to a user now this will always have to be a secondary mechanism at any sort of scale. Primary authz will always have to be done by groups because your admin can't keep up with everyone who authenticates. 

Given that i think it's a perfectly reasonable limitation that a person must log in before you can escalate their privileges based on a user_id."}, {'account_id': 18338, 'date': '2016-06-01 15:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Lets hold off on this.  While we may still want to add these APIs, I know Dolph is working on a spec to solve this use case by improving our mapping engine.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2016-06-01 16:08:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

From the meeting yesterday - I think Dolph has a spec on the way that will address this spec. 

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-meeting/%23openstack-meeting.2016-05-31.log.html#t2016-05-31T18:21:41'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2016-06-01 20:21:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I proposed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324055/ as an alternative approach.'}, {'account_id': 17860, 'date': '2016-06-14 11:45:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

At this point, it looks like we're going with Dolph's spec. Perhaps this can be abandoned ? Or is this buying us something else ?"}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2016-07-04 03:40:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

please respond to dolph's question -- does https://review.openstack.org/#/c/324055/ address the issue here?"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2016-12-01 21:19:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

So, no, Dolph's spec does not completely address the issues that this brings up.  That only works for hard-coded workflows.  If the user neds to be assigned to a project on and ad-hoc basis, it still cannot be done until the user visits the cloud.

These APIs also allow for externalizing Authorization( running in a different service), but reusing the mapping as set up by Keystone."}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2016-12-01 21:20:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-12-01 21:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

- gate-keystone-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial http://logs.openstack.org/04/313604/2/check/gate-keystone-specs-python27-ubuntu-xenial/f2afac9/ : FAILURE in 2m 39s'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2016-12-08 04:59:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

with http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ocata/support-federated-attr.html approved can we abandon this?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2016-12-12 14:58:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

No, spec is insufficient.  This one can be adjusted to account for that spec, though.  http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/ocata/support-federated-attr.html but that one does not provide sufficient information for an external actor to perform the mapping, among other things.'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2016-12-16 02:08:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

procedural -2 since we are at spec freeze'}, {'account_id': 6482, 'date': '2017-04-22 02:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:39:54.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

Colleen: Thanks for the review.  Lets keep the convo on this review until you feel satisfied with my answers, and then I will update to try and make things clearer.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-10-05 16:32:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

subject: Rename index file of doc translations
messages:
[{'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-10-26 08:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-26 09:48:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-26 09:48:56.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-26 09:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Not really a good judge but it sounds ok to me.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-26 15:57:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Why can sphinx not find the translated index file? What's the counterpart to this?"}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-10-27 16:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@AJaeger: Seems that the change itself does not explain the drawback on what I18n team is doing on openstack-ansible repo. Please see https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613752 for better capture the motivation of this patch and how this simple patch improves, although doc.po needs to be manually cleaned.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-10-27 16:57:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Q: How to match other rst files such as glossary.rst in horizon repo: http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/horizon/tree/doc/source/glossary.rst ?'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-27 17:24:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ian, glossary and everything else top-level should be in doc.pot today - so, if this goes in, it should be in doc-index.

Still not sure whether this will work - or whether it needs additional work similar to https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613752/1/tools/build-docs.sh

Did anybody checked this?'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-10-28 00:21:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Ian, glossary and everything else top-level should be in doc.pot
 > today - so, if this goes in, it should be in doc-index.

To publish translated documents, as far as I know, *.mo files matching with pot file names from "sphinx-build -b gettext" are needed. doc.pot has all resources on top-level folder in doc/source. Renaming doc.pot to doc-index.pot will only match with index.pot from "sphinx-build -b gettext" and does not match with other top-level pot files.

 > Did anybody checked this?

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613752/2/tools/build-docs.sh@44 is an enhanced version without requiring this patch - it publishes well locally but need to be more tested with other repos.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-10-28 06:00:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

> > Ian, glossary and everything else top-level should be in doc.pot
 > > today - so, if this goes in, it should be in doc-index.
 > 
 > To publish translated documents, as far as I know, *.mo files
 > matching with pot file names from "sphinx-build -b gettext" are
 > needed. doc.pot has all resources on top-level folder in
 > doc/source. Renaming doc.pot to doc-index.pot will only match with
 > index.pot from "sphinx-build -b gettext" and does not match with
 > other top-level pot files.

So, you're saying that this change is wrong - and would need a similar workaround then you in the other change? That's my feeling as well... 

Giving a -1 based on these comments - I won't +2 this without a change that shows that this does the right thing and simplifies stuff.

While the rename is harmless here, means we need to retranslate files already translated and it does not change the need for special handling of the top level directory at all.'}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-10-30 21:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

subject: [WIP] Add os_i18n_tools package
messages:
[{'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-09-28 18:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-28 18:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

this is a simple script - no need to push a python package just for one script.

I would place this in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repo - together with a role that copies the file over, and uses it to build translations.

Example: roles/fetch-subunit-output/files in zuul-jobs repo.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-09-29 06:38:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Although I agree that this is a simple script, I would more encourage to have a Python package in openstack/i18n repo and make use of the package in openstack-zuul-job repo for the better health in I18n team. I have some thoughts:

- I18n team not only contributes translation but also all internationalization steps including maintaining such scripts. Since there is no artifact on openstack/i18n repo, it is not so easy for me (+ current PTL, Frank, from my understanding) to encourage people to participate in I18n team on latter part. The package might embrace not only this script but also a few more scripts such as [1] and [2].
- I hope that more I18n team members recognize and follow OpenStack ecosystem with release activities: not only translating activities with releases but also how new version of artifacts are release through the communication with Release Management team.
- Also I imagine if scripts are helpful to other communities. I think it would be very nice if we write a good story or article how to make use of os_i18n_tools (I have not considered this naming deeply but anyway) for better I18n for more communities.

I am open to follow @AJaeger but want to discuss with such perspective.

Q: If infra repos would be a better place, then do you have some rationale between openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs and openstack-infra/project-config? I am asking since I am curious why [1] and [2] are in project-config, not in openstack-zuul-jobs.

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/roles/prep-zanata/files/create-zanata-xml.py
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack-infra/project-config/tree/roles/prep-zanata/files/ZanataUtils.py

 > this is a simple script - no need to push a python package just for
 > one script.
 > 
 > I would place this in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repo -
 > together with a role that copies the file over, and uses it to
 > build translations.
 > 
 > Example: roles/fetch-subunit-output/files in zuul-jobs repo.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-29 07:12:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ian, see https://review.openstack.org/525760 - we're in the process of moving it over.

And yes, consolidating all of these in one place is an option.

But let's figure out a plan and steps on what to do."}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-09-29 07:39:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> this is a simple script - no need to push a python package just for
 > one script.
 > 
 > I would place this in openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repo -
 > together with a role that copies the file over, and uses it to
 > build translations.
 > 
 > Example: roles/fetch-subunit-output/files in zuul-jobs repo.

From the perspective of CI/CD and Zuul, I would do this. But how can I build language docs then locally? The idea behind the package is the same like here: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstack-manuals/tree/tox.ini#n68
The script and package is maintained by I18n team, the script can called by tox locally and Zuul.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-29 08:07:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, this is the challenge, you have two constraints:

* For translations of manuals, openstack-tox-docs is used and *no* changes to a repo should be done. So, you want to update a single place.

* For debugging purposes, it's good to have it in one place.

So, you need to do these things at least:

* Update openstack-tox-docs so that it runs the translation script if there are translations (the job is defined in openstack-zuul-jobs, the publish one in project-config)

* Create a translation build script.

* Create roles (ansible) to run the translation build script - or integrate the translation build script in a role (like we do for releasenotes publishing).


You can also merge releasenotes translation build script and the docs build script, it should be a similiar logic.

What about a spec or an etherpad to write down all the steps, discuss - and then go forward..."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-29 08:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-06 18:29:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

I agree that this kind of things should be started with a discussion like spec or other way, though I don't think I can join the discussion."}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-10-30 21:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Delete "Preparing your environment" section

The "Preparing your environment" section on the configuration page is
out of date as it still refers to the service token. It is also out of
place for this page and is redundant with the installation guide[1] and
the developer environment guide[2]. Just delete it.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/install/index.html
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/contributor/set-up-keystone.html

Change-Id: I1e3a17044260b2ca378a01c836b3fb6bfabe0e6d

commit_message:
Set Default and resource limit as defined schema

Default_limit and Resource_limit should not be set
as negative values or out of range. This patch
addresses the above issue be checking the limit
passed by the user should be minimum and maximum to
the values defined in schema. If not, then raising
the 400 bad request. Also added the test cases for the
same.

Change-Id: I089f3c231a38be1a1f769a35b4904f5c078d5d07
Closes-Bug: #1797876

commit_message:
Replace openSUSE experimental check with newer version

We're migrating now to openSUSE 15.0 (yes, 15.0 is newer than 42.3),
remove legacy job and replace with native Zuul v3 job running python3.

Change-Id: Ic7af06ed7dfe4bd95c6f9cf0a24bfd986b6ad8f5
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/609359

[{'created': '2018-10-24 18:03:16.000000000', 'message': 'quota: remove unused Quota driver methods

The BaseResource.quota() method was the only method calling the
QuotaDriver.get_by_project(), get_by_project_and_user() and
get_by_class() methods. The BaseResource.quota() method was only being
called from unit tests. The last patch in this series removed that
method and now the QuotaDriver.get_by_project(),
get_by_project_and_user() and get_by_class() methods can now be removed
since they have no callers other than unit tests.

Change-Id: Iec72af79867c1d992ad109a0d0528431c61f22b4
'}]
commit_message:
quota: remove unused Quota driver methods

The BaseResource.quota() method was the only method calling the
QuotaDriver.get_by_project(), get_by_project_and_user() and
get_by_class() methods. The BaseResource.quota() method was only being
called from unit tests. The last patch in this series removed that
method and now the QuotaDriver.get_by_project(),
get_by_project_and_user() and get_by_class() methods can now be removed
since they have no callers other than unit tests.

Change-Id: Iec72af79867c1d992ad109a0d0528431c61f22b4

commit_message:
Correct rhsm_force_registration var name in defaults.

According to the README.md and the variables used
in the tasks, the right name for this variable is
rhsm_force_register.

Change-Id: Ica4dc7f5fb6e56a90d3e7036c3ac8f5f6a231212

subject: Remove setup.py check from pep8 job
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 15:38:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I9c760887d90869a44af62f4a4c4c09d3599f6047
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

commit_message:
Raise NotFound error when retrieved by not uuid

On identity-projects page:
  Retrieve project list filtered by id which is not uuid format like '%',
there will throw an error message on top-right page.
And the same for identity-users page.

It is reasonable that return an empty list without error prompt.

Change-Id: I65aec86f4d894a9789eef6fc093ed95a95c46d9f
Closes-Bug: #1800600

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 17:01:06.000000000', 'message': "tox: Stop build *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref',
'api-guide' and 'placement-api-ref', in addition to 'doc'. This
massively increases the amount of time docs take to build both locally
and in the gate. It's not necessary for gate, since separate jobs take
care of the other documents for us [1]. As such, we should stop doing
it. For users that *do* care about this (for whatever reason) a new
'all-docs' target is included.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L5578-L5595

Change-Id: I58bd50e869fc00dde5dd388efb686a7196c8db80
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Stop build *all* docs in 'docs'

The 'docs' target currently builds the documentation trees in 'api-ref',
'api-guide' and 'placement-api-ref', in addition to 'doc'. This
massively increases the amount of time docs take to build both locally
and in the gate. It's not necessary for gate, since separate jobs take
care of the other documents for us [1]. As such, we should stop doing
it. For users that *do* care about this (for whatever reason) a new
'all-docs' target is included.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-infra/project-config/blob/master/zuul.d/projects.yaml#L5578-L5595

Change-Id: I58bd50e869fc00dde5dd388efb686a7196c8db80
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
PowerVM: update_provider_tree() (compatible)

Implement the update_provider_tree ComputeDriver method in the
PowerVMDriver.

In this patch, we *just* implement it to be backward compatible with how
the resource tracker populates the compute node resource provider
inventory based on get_available_resource. Future patches will bring
sanity to such values as allocation_ratio, min_unit, and reserved.
Future patches (as part of larger efforts) will also handle providers
and/or inventories for SR-IOV, devices, etc.

Change-Id: I96da858e6a63e3339a009fd17ee0d8939b364510

[{'created': '2017-12-20 14:57:30.000000000', 'message': "Cleanups for the scheduler code

A few small cleanups here:

* There is some old code comments saying that get_host_states
  returned an iterator or a list, but those are both wrong. We
  haven't returned an iterator since 4660333d0 in Ocata. We return
  a tuple of HostState objects.
* Cleans up some variable usage and alignment.
* Removes an unused variable from a test class.
* Adds a FIXME note about how we are potentially using the wrong
  user_id when creating allocations during move operations.

Change-Id: Ief1af2c1b09af6f4ee4add36b5a793344cea84d7
"}, {'created': '2018-10-25 19:42:36.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanups for the scheduler code

commit_message:
Cleanups for the scheduler code

A few small cleanups here:

* Cleans up some variable usage and alignment.
* Removes an unused variable from a test class.
* Adds a FIXME note about how we are potentially using the wrong
  user_id when creating allocations during move operations.

Change-Id: Ief1af2c1b09af6f4ee4add36b5a793344cea84d7

[{'created': '2018-10-23 14:28:54.000000000', 'message': "Fix test bug when host doesn't have /etc/machine-id

Libvirt tests which execute _get_host_sysinfo_serial_os will fail
unless the test host has a valid /etc/machine-id. This change mocks
the above function in the libvirt fixture. This requires pulling the
tests for this method out of LibvirtConnTestCase, which uses the
libvirt fixture.

Change-Id: I3c210d77aaefdbb369fba40ed7bdad5e476472a5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix test bug when host doesn't have /etc/machine-id

Libvirt tests which execute _get_host_sysinfo_serial_os will fail
unless the test host has a valid /etc/machine-id. This change mocks
the above function in the libvirt fixture. This requires pulling the
tests for this method out of LibvirtConnTestCase, which uses the
libvirt fixture.

Change-Id: I3c210d77aaefdbb369fba40ed7bdad5e476472a5

commit_message:
Restructure Huawei driver

As part of further refactoring work, this pulls out common driver code
into its own file to better organize the code.

Change-Id: Ib5b52b638e27743d86106cc9859f8adeab2aab08
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add framework for congress-status upgrade check

This commit adds the functionality of congress-status CLI for performing
upgrade checks as part of the Stein cycle upgrade-checkers goal.
It only includes a sample check which must be replaced by real checks in
future.

Change-Id: I27204c1c2dce2443eaa18a85144cbc892d61b551
Story: 2003657
Task: 26125

commit_message:
Remove restart_scheduler_service() method

This is no longer used since the CachingScheduler was
removed in change I1832da2190be5ef2b04953938860a56a43e8cddf
and the related tests were updated.

Change-Id: Idfcdb320901cbb9743547f37afe5a36b7425ac12

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-30 18:38:10.000000000', 'message': 'Move sphinx-feature-classification to docs reqs

This was added in the main requirements.txt, but it is not a
requirement for running the service. This moves it to the
docs/requirements.txt file so it is only installed for doc builds.

Change-Id: I37026b9be913ccf157fce711f2d85fc05342e891
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Move sphinx-feature-classification to docs reqs

This was added in the main requirements.txt, but it is not a
requirement for running the service. This moves it to the
docs/requirements.txt file so it is only installed for doc builds.

Change-Id: I37026b9be913ccf157fce711f2d85fc05342e891
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-15 13:48:21.000000000', 'message': 'Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Increment versioning with pbr instruction

With moving away from required milestone releases, the version numbers
calculated by PBR on the master branch will not work for those testing
upgrades from the last stable release. More details can be found in the
mailing list post here:

    http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/135706.html

This is an empty commit that will cause PBR to increment its calculated
version to get around this.

PBR will see the following which will cause it to increment the version:

Sem-Ver: feature

Please merge this patch as soon as possible to support those testing
upgrades.

Change-Id: I898f327003c68ee6f66d1a70e1b25a49336424f1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Filter ports in list_ports when batching is in effect

When caching is in effect, we always fetch ports in a raw list with no
push-down filters. However, people calling list_ports with the filters
argument should expect it to work whether push-down conditions are used
or not. Wrap the return in a filter list so that we apply the filters
client-side in that case.

Story: 2004207
Task: 27716
Change-Id: Ieabb3193c320bd9c0e569e2e7cef983529a6fbdb

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 15:38:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I7c17371b9f43c50bf07a460e1a3a731bf6d6a793
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I7c17371b9f43c50bf07a460e1a3a731bf6d6a793
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove setup.py check from pep8 job

Using "python setup.py check -r -s" method of checking the package has
been deprecated with the new recommendation to build the sdist and
wheel, then running "twine check" against the output.

Luckily, there is already a job that covers this that only runs when the
README, setup.py, or setup.cfg files change, making running this in the
pep8 job redundant. This covered by the test-release-openstack-python3
that is defined in the publish-to-pypi-python3 template.

More details can be found in this mailing list post:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-October/136136.html

Change-Id: I359d557dbf3438d219bed0303b7a95ad93192f46
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[tools] build-docs.sh: matches po files in Zanata

Unlike guides in doc/source directory such as
admin, contributor, and user, current build-docs.sh [1]
cannot match pot files from rst files on doc/source folder
such as index.pot generated from "sphinx-build -b gettext"
with doc.po which actually has translated resources on the folder.

This commit patches build-docs.sh to make:
  - if there is a corresponding doc-{resname}.po from {resname}.pot,
    then matching between those files is correct
  - if there is not a corresponding doc-{resname}.po,
    then matching with doc.pot is correct.
  - enhance a logic to revert po files since there are multiple
    po files to be reverted.

Change-Id: I8d1899e9ff6697b9793105dca45b2753a3546266

(9 comments)

I'm aware this is a WIP, but just a few comments. This is looking good at this point."}, {'account_id': 28848, 'date': '2018-10-23 15:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 28848, 'date': '2018-10-23 17:24:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-10-23 17:25:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

is there a reason ozone cannot use mariadb 10.2?'}, {'account_id': 28848, 'date': '2018-10-23 17:34:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> is there a reason ozone cannot use mariadb 10.2?

Per Dan Steven: Ozone has been tested with MySQL 5.6 and is pushing to be cross-platform compatible with AIC and NC 1.x.'}, {'account_id': 28701, 'date': '2018-10-23 17:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

(8 comments)'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Why is this deploying its own database rather than relying on (and creating a dependency on) openstack-helm-infra/mariadb.'}, {'account_id': 28848, 'date': '2018-10-25 13:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 28701, 'date': '2018-10-25 13:51:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

If this is just doing MariaDB, is it possible to use the MariaDB chart in openstack-helm-infra and specify different overrides?

If this was an Ozone chart I think it would make sense to have MariaDB as a dependency and the other Ozone components included in this chart. But since this is just the DB it feels like this could be overrides via Armada Chart?

I might be way off base, so I'd wait for feedback from the cores."}, {'account_id': 28848, 'date': '2018-10-29 17:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 20466, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:21:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

I concur with Alan and Dustin's assessment - we already have a DB chart at [0] with features (like the LMA feature), maintaining a separate but slightly different chart will just cause maintenance overhead down the line - is there a reason we can't use override?

[0] https://github.com/openstack/openstack-helm-infra/tree/master/mariadb/templates"}, {'account_id': 28848, 'date': '2018-10-30 18:57:00.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Base MariaDB Chart will be used.'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-09 13:47:39.000000000', 'message': "Handle drivers that do not support list manageable

Listing manageable volumes and snapshots is not a required feature for
drivers and not all of them support it. If a user attempts to list
objects when using a backend that does not support it, they currently
get a somewhat cryptic and internally-exposing error message:

AttributeError: 'RBDDriver' object has no attribute 'get_manageable_snapshots'

This updates the manager to better handle the case where a driver does
not support listing volumes and snapshots.

Closes-bug: #1796784

Change-Id: Ib6cdbe22ad22841c7a166f722eee981913396af4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Handle drivers that do not support list manageable

Listing manageable volumes and snapshots is not a required feature for
drivers and not all of them support it. If a user attempts to list
objects when using a backend that does not support it, they currently
get a somewhat cryptic and internally-exposing error message:

AttributeError: 'RBDDriver' object has no attribute 'get_manageable_snapshots'

This updates the manager to better handle the case where a driver does
not support listing volumes and snapshots.

Closes-bug: #1796784

Change-Id: Ib6cdbe22ad22841c7a166f722eee981913396af4
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[DNM/POC] Load apparmor profile via helm

This is a proof of concept for loading an apparmor profile
via a daemonset in a helm chart.

This creates a sample nginx chart which loads a basic apparmor
profile that prevents a variety of operations, a simple one is
being able to write to /tmp. This also adds a much simpler profile
to the memcached chart which allows access to /tmp. A test is
included to show the functionality

                _,.---.---.---.--.._
            _.-' `--.`---.`---'-. _,`--.._
           /`--._ .'.     `.     `,`-.`-._\
          ||   \  `.`---.__`__..-`. ,'`-._/
     _  ,`\ `-._\   \    `.    `_.-`-._,``-.
  ,`   `-_ \/ `-.`--.\    _\_.-'\__.-`-.`-._`.
 (_.o> ,--. `._/'--.-`,--`  \_.-'       \`-._ \
  `---'    `._ `---._/__,----`           `-. `-\
            /_, ,  _..-'                    `-._\
            \_, \/ ._(
             \_, \/ ._\
              `._,\/ ._\
                `._// ./`-._
                  `-._-_-_.-'

Change-Id: I5f5e9aa7111f9c9517b3b3ace4ae03df8e02e963

Add gate jobs

Add missing py35 target.

Remove some unintended UTF-8 characters in metadata.yaml.

Change-Id: I44569081a7b133a224870922c6aae61dda700540

Add the new cybord-status command to the list of bin files.

Change-Id: I0b132d789649ede62de42fe38fadf62737d2566d

commit_message:
Remove deprecated HPE Lefthand config opts

Several configuration options were renamed as part of the driver rename
in the Mitaka release. This removes the deprecated_name for these
options.

Change-Id: I8bf5570960728b3bb65631ce02850c120af40577
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 16:55:56.000000000', 'message': "Ensure VNX unit tests don't sleep

Some VNX unit tests were taking over 30 seconds to complete due to some
sleeps not being adjusted for test runs. To make sure all tests are
protected from hitting these through unexpected paths, and to ensure
consistency, this adds a base test class that the others inherit from.
This makes sure the sleep values are always adjusted and provides a
common place for things to be set up for all tests.

Change-Id: I7721dd1078f260f820d5883022040d2eef9949bf
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure VNX unit tests don't sleep

Some VNX unit tests were taking over 30 seconds to complete due to some
sleeps not being adjusted for test runs. To make sure all tests are
protected from hitting these through unexpected paths, and to ensure
consistency, this adds a base test class that the others inherit from.
This makes sure the sleep values are always adjusted and provides a
common place for things to be set up for all tests.

Change-Id: I7721dd1078f260f820d5883022040d2eef9949bf
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Remove deprecated iSCSI target config opts

The iSCSI target config options were deprecated in favor of more general
target config options in the Queens release. This completes the removal
of those options.

Change-Id: Ic65eed63c1de4f4888d572dad5bf9e945bceb16b
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-10 17:05:28.000000000', 'message': 'Remove volume:get policy from test policy file

There is a policy file maintained specifically for testing that
overrides the default policies so that they are easier to test
against. Ideally, we should make it so that it easier to test the
default policies instead of overriding them since this would help us
prevent regression when policies are change. An example of how to do
this was implemented in the following patch:

  I88354ec57849e59764b1f5b0233be4fa1ef70c38

The more tests cases that are covered like that, the more policies we
can remove from cinder/tests/unit/policy.json. Once that file is empty
we should have satisfactory test coverage of the default policies that
are maintained in code.

Change-Id: Ia6c2e51fa88811e04f1c312f003b7b2524d90072
'}]
commit_message:
Remove volume:get policy from test policy file

There is a policy file maintained specifically for testing that
overrides the default policies so that they are easier to test
against. Ideally, we should make it so that it easier to test the
default policies instead of overriding them since this would help us
prevent regression when policies are change. An example of how to do
this was implemented in the following patch:

  I88354ec57849e59764b1f5b0233be4fa1ef70c38

The more tests cases that are covered like that, the more policies we
can remove from cinder/tests/unit/policy.json. Once that file is empty
we should have satisfactory test coverage of the default policies that
are maintained in code.

Change-Id: Ia6c2e51fa88811e04f1c312f003b7b2524d90072

Install python3-mistralclient in Fedora or RedHat > 7

Fedora repo [1] has python3 packages, start consuming those.

[1] http://trunk.rdoproject.org/fedora/puppet-passed-ci/

Also fix client_package name.

I think that this will require a lot of extra work because if we go python3 only path:

- `pip` command will not be available, "python3 -m pip" being the way to call it
- `virtualenv` command will not be available, "python3 -m virtualenv" being the way to call it
- virtualenv package is called python3-virtualenv on fc28 and python-virtualenv on centos7

We already have almost identical logic for qs.sh, we should try to avoid writing the same code in n-places.

I am not sure yet on how to approach it.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:08:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-11 11:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-15 06:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-15 06:10:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Patch Set 12 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-15 07:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-15 08:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-15 09:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2018-10-15 09:32:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
OLD: Add fedora28 support for quickstart

- Updates the yum calls to be either yum or dnf
- libvirt standalone deployment support
- a playbook required for libvrt based standalone deployments

Closes-Bug: #1788270
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591540/
Co-Authored-By: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie302fa7f89a1b6826564f95da88c600d300e39e7
Signed-off-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

WIP: udpate reproducer to install required deps

when libguestfs-tools is missing it causes
virt-customize errors

[{'created': '2018-10-29 16:32:46.000000000', 'message': 'Make Connection a context manager

For people who are wanting to make sure Connection resources are cleaned
up, add __enter__ and __exit__ methods so that one can do:

and be sure that things are cleaned properly.

Change-Id: I077dd09de7859c8e81c8090c847ecd5d72c4318e
'}]
commit_message:
Make Connection a context manager

For people who are wanting to make sure Connection resources are cleaned
up, add __enter__ and __exit__ methods so that one can do:

  with Connection() as conn:
    conn.be_awesome()

and be sure that things are cleaned properly.

Change-Id: I077dd09de7859c8e81c8090c847ecd5d72c4318e

Change-Id: I70d55a203c3104f70e3837db9601a1ebfe6fbd1f
'}]
commit_message:
Add close method to shutdown threadpool

There are contexts where people need to ensure a threadpool shuts down.
Add a close method that can be used to ensure releasing of resources.

Change-Id: I70d55a203c3104f70e3837db9601a1ebfe6fbd1f

[{'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-10-18 17:22:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-10-18 17:26:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-10-19 11:58:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Usually, we don't backport new configuration options but this one relates to a security issue so I would like to get more feedback first"}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-10-19 16:23:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Usually, we don't backport new configuration options but this one
 > relates to a security issue so I would like to get more feedback
 > first

Understood. That was my concern as well. But security is the overriding factor. Network segmentation is a fairly common pattern. Without this patch, WebSSO would not be possible. Since the new configuration is optional and have no default, there should not be any issues with both backward and forward compatibility."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-23 12:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

The stable backport policy does not accept a new configuration option. It just denies "Incompatible config file changes". This backport sounds reasonable to me.

On the other hand, there are some to be improved.

https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#review-guidelines'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-23 16:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-18 17:22:44.000000000', 'message': "support WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL

Add a new optional WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL property to facilitate WEBSSO
deployments where network segmentation is used per security requirement.
In this case, the controllers are not reachable from public network.
Therefore, user's browser will not be able to reach OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL
if it is set to the internal endpoint.

If WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL is set, it will be used instead of
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL.

Change-Id: I05ea4227aa4c2cb0a73015ed7fd29cf1a96e696a
Closes-bug: #1544703

commit_message:
support WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL

Add a new optional WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL property to facilitate WEBSSO
deployments where network segmentation is used per security requirement.
In this case, the controllers are not reachable from public network.
Therefore, user's browser will not be able to reach OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL
if it is set to the internal endpoint.

If WEBSSO_KEYSTONE_URL is set, it will be used instead of
OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_URL.

Change-Id: I05ea4227aa4c2cb0a73015ed7fd29cf1a96e696a
Closes-bug: #1544703
(cherry picked from commit a53f012fa1c0724ee4d532e782e6b2fe88ef8fa8)

commit_message:
tasks: cinder_qos: Use the new OpenStack CLI client

Previous fix that changed grep options broke things even more.
This commit changes way how we create and associate QoS rules utilising
python-openstackclient.
It handles correctly cases where names contain their fragments in other.

Related-Bug: #1741990
Change-Id: If6181059f1bb1f582537ebe646f81c0a8d33d59c

The original code is monkey-patching keystoneclient object to add a
user_id attribute to it. This no longer works with more recent
versions of keystoneclient, as they wrap the client in a helper
class.

I'm not happy with this solution, it's likely to have side effects
and to break again. I'm putting it up for discussion for a better
solution.

Change-Id: Idb296d1b10fa02a0b4852e96fe8cb2bdd70380e0

commit_message:
Fix changing user's own password

The original code is monkey-patching keystoneclient object to add a
user_id attribute to it. This no longer works with more recent
versions of keystoneclient, as they wrap the client in a helper
class.

I'm not happy with this solution, it's likely to have side effects
and to break again. I'm putting it up for discussion for a better
solution.

Change-Id: Idb296d1b10fa02a0b4852e96fe8cb2bdd70380e0
Closes-bug: #1776678
(cherry picked from commit bdb3f9d988afa23619af4d8c013ffa062347aa5f)

commit_message:
Add a link to "Add Generation to Consumers" spec

The "handle allocation updates in a safe way" item and
the link to "Add Generation to Consumers" spec have been added
since I77f34788dd7ab8fdf60d668a4f76452e03cf9888 in the nova doc
(doc/source/user/placement.rst).

But it has not been added yet in the placement doc
(doc/source/index.rst). So add it.

Change-Id: I4c70da34d8907cab2373b1349bb2c6e9b8cdd35a

commit_message:
Fix the depreacated policy doesn't work as expect

If the deprecated policy exist in the policy file, it should work
instead of the default policy as well.

Change-Id: I5846b801fd458501bbc4e0825212e0b9d5a97e67
Closes-bug: #1800259

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-24 16:29:20.000000000', 'message': 'Start rabbitmq service when config is in place

rabbitmq is started three times:

1st time in rabbitmq_install with default config
2nd time in rabbitmq_set_cookie with default config
3rd time in rabbitmq_post_install with OSA config

however, there is no need for that and we can remove the 1st one and
the 2nd as it uses a default config which might break deployments
(e.g. if number of threads is limited through cgroups)

Change-Id: Iaef3b91d2a555bf0681f4a7d018d6d93e93889b4
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-24 16:39:41.000000000', 'message': 'Start rabbitmq service when config is in place

rabbitmq is started three times:

1st time in rabbitmq_install with default config
2nd time in rabbitmq_set_cookie with default config
3rd time in rabbitmq_post_install with OSA config

however, there is no need for that and we can remove the 1st one and
the 2nd as it uses a default config which might break deployments
(e.g. if number of threads is limited through cgroups)

Change-Id: Iaef3b91d2a555bf0681f4a7d018d6d93e93889b4
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Start rabbitmq service when config is in place

rabbitmq is started three times:

1st time in rabbitmq_install with default config
2nd time in rabbitmq_set_cookie with default config
3rd time in rabbitmq_post_install with OSA config

however, there is no need for that and we can remove the 1st one and
the 2nd as it uses a default config which might break deployments
(e.g. if number of threads is limited through cgroups)

Change-Id: Iaef3b91d2a555bf0681f4a7d018d6d93e93889b4
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

commit_message:
Open file as binary to write bytes

Due to a change in the return types in the base64
decoded data, we should open these files in binary
mode to write the byte streams directly.

Change-Id: I9f88a71406b1e6ea774fdbbeea4ba447901fe5c2
Closes-Bug: #1800436

commit_message:
Speed up getting the container name

First attempt to discover by direct matching of a name to
the label container_name. Then fallback to getting the full
list with ps (which is a much slower operation for podman)

This somewhat speed ups paunch apply, with action=exec,
when doing concurrent container operations.

Related-Bug: #1797525

Change-Id: Ia37132d44fa49682f47ddda9490c6547a028c8af
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-25 07:43:23.000000000', 'message': '[Functional] Increase test_timeout for db migration tests

Patch [1] increased timeouts for test_walk_version functional tests
for MySQL backend to 300 seconds to avoid failures due to timeouts.

Unfortunately it looks that on nodes from some cloud providers used
in the gate and with number of migration scripts which we have in
Neutron those tests can take sometimes even around 400 seconds.

So lets increase this to 600 seconds to avoid such failures of
functional tests job.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I9d129f0e90a072ec980aadabb2c6b812c08e1618
Closes-Bug: #1687027
(cherry picked from commit c39afbd5fcdfff2ad5e7f6963768da9f3d8027d2)
'}]
commit_message:
[Functional] Increase test_timeout for db migration tests

Patch [1] increased timeouts for test_walk_version functional tests
for MySQL backend to 300 seconds to avoid failures due to timeouts.

Unfortunately it looks that on nodes from some cloud providers used
in the gate and with number of migration scripts which we have in
Neutron those tests can take sometimes even around 400 seconds.

So lets increase this to 600 seconds to avoid such failures of
functional tests job.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610003/

Change-Id: I9d129f0e90a072ec980aadabb2c6b812c08e1618
Closes-Bug: #1687027
(cherry picked from commit c39afbd5fcdfff2ad5e7f6963768da9f3d8027d2)

Closes-Bug: 1800491
Change-Id: I9a074a1911f062557ed642d84af6165d01558a69
'}]
commit_message:
Remove race between sync_pools and other pool actions

This patch ensures that no actions are done on the pools
while they have not been yet initialized, i.e., make them
wait for the kuryr-controller to be ready

Closes-Bug: 1800491
Change-Id: I9a074a1911f062557ed642d84af6165d01558a69

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 18:29:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix incorrect use of flake8:noqa

Adding the comment flake8:noqa in a file will skip linting the entire
file. Most of the time, the intent was just to skip individual lines to
handle exception cases.

This gets rid of the "flake8:" prefix where it was used incorrectly and
fixes a few legitimate errors that were being hidden by the entire file
being skipped.

The behavior is change in flake8 to handle this better, which will
result in pep8 job failures if these are not fixes first. See more
information in the 3.6.0 release notes:

http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/release-notes/3.6.0.html#features

Change-Id: I56cb20a7c8885c101826d4fe28c315de02b6ecb8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incorrect use of flake8:noqa

Adding the comment flake8:noqa in a file will skip linting the entire
file. Most of the time, the intent was just to skip individual lines to
handle exception cases.

This gets rid of the "flake8:" prefix where it was used incorrectly and
fixes a few legitimate errors that were being hidden by the entire file
being skipped.

The behavior is change in flake8 to handle this better, which will
result in pep8 job failures if these are not fixes first. See more
information in the 3.6.0 release notes:

http://flake8.pycqa.org/en/latest/release-notes/3.6.0.html#features

Change-Id: I56cb20a7c8885c101826d4fe28c315de02b6ecb8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

In web-download import method functional tests we are trying to download

Here we are assuming image is downloaded and will be active within 20

from the CI environment which sometimes causes these tests to either
timeout or failure.

commit_message:
Fixed intermittent timeout/failing functional tests

In web-download import method functional tests we are trying to download
a file from 'https://www.openstack.org/assets/openstack-logo/2016R/OpenStack-Logo-Horizontal.eps.zip'.
Here we are assuming image is downloaded and will be active within 20
seconds else will be marked as failed. As of now these tests never
fails in local environment but, external networking will always be unreliable
from the CI environment which sometimes causes these tests to either
timeout or failure.

Instead of using external URL to download the image, deploying local http
server to dowload local image.

Closes-Bug: #1797571
Change-Id: I781666327f092ad439c23eca57128b8fd0334c89

commit_message:
Remove race between sync_pools and _get_port_from_pool

This patch ensures that if there is an attempt to allocate a
port during the pod creation but the kuryr-controller has not yet
finished its sync_pool initialization, a ResourceNotReady exception
will be triggered and the port allocation attempt will be retried
later

Closes-Bug: 1800431
Change-Id: I92671523db6e9efc40ff248018c4e081fae750ed
(cherry picked from commit a8567e9d4a922cd4e3eeb8846864b269d64c7cad)

commit_message:
config-download documentation enhancements

Adds docs for:
- warnings around skipping specific tasks
- setting the status manually
- generating the overcloudrc
- note about tasks with variables in their names don't work with
  --start-at-task.

Change-Id: I8e526687b9f53eb125c439d8125494156831cb68

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-15 15:52:28.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: vif_plug_ovs: add should_provide_port

os-vif is designed to aid briding the compute and networking worlds,
making certain assumptions case by case on the responsabilities of who
should provide host ports and plug them to the host networking system.
For example, on compute machines it is libvirt who creates TAP devices
and connects to whichever network backend bridge is being used (e.g.
Open vSwitch, Linux Bridge). In such case, os-vif handles exclusively
the low-level network plumbing. On other hypervisors (e.g. Hyper-V),
os-vif creates the user-facing ports.

One scenario that os-vif does not cover, and this patch tries to
address, is the support for systems other than OpenStack compute
providers with the aforementioned assumptions. Services requiring an
interface connected to a project network can now request os-vif to
facilitate creation of TAP devices (VIFBridge) or OVS internal ports
(VIFOpenVSwitch) and plugging to the network.

Supported VIF types: VIFBridge and VIFOpenVSwitch

TODO:
- vif_plug_linux_bridge: VIFBridge
- tests

Change-Id: I2a2ccec28375e56cfbc8f68af283f9ec09d7c155

One scenario that os-vif does not cover, and this patch tries to
address, is the support for systems other than OpenStack compute
providers with the aforementioned assumptions. Services requiring an
interface connected to a project network can now request os-vif to
facilitate creation of TAP devices (VIFBridge) or OVS internal ports
(VIFOpenVSwitch) and plugging to the network.

Supported VIF types: VIFBridge and VIFOpenVSwitch

TODO:
- vif_plug_linux_bridge: VIFBridge
- tests
- doc

Change-Id: I2a2ccec28375e56cfbc8f68af283f9ec09d7c155
'}]
commit_message:
[DNM] vif_plug_ovs: add should_provide_port

os-vif is designed to aid briding the compute and networking worlds,
making certain assumptions case by case on the responsabilities of who
should provide host ports and plug them to the host networking system.
For example, on compute machines it is libvirt who creates TAP devices
and connects to whichever network backend bridge is being used (e.g.
Open vSwitch, Linux Bridge). In such case, os-vif handles exclusively
the low-level network plumbing. On other hypervisors (e.g. Hyper-V),
os-vif creates the user-facing ports.

One scenario that os-vif does not cover, and this patch tries to
address, is the support for systems other than OpenStack compute
providers with the aforementioned assumptions. Services requiring an
interface connected to a project network can now request os-vif to
facilitate creation of TAP devices (VIFBridge) or OVS internal ports
(VIFOpenVSwitch) and plugging to the network.

Supported VIF types: VIFBridge and VIFOpenVSwitch

TODO:
- vif_plug_linux_bridge: VIFBridge
- tests
- doc

Change-Id: I2a2ccec28375e56cfbc8f68af283f9ec09d7c155

[{'created': '2018-10-29 12:24:39.000000000', 'message': 'Enable optionally wrapping JSON requests to external checks

This adds a ``remote_json_wrapper_key`` configuration parameter, which
wraps the JSON document with the specified key.

If we configure this parameter to be "input" for instance, the request
will be:

{
    "input": {
        "rule": <the rule>,
        "target": <the target>,
        "credentials: <the credentials>
    }
}

This was done because some policy engines (such as Open Policy Agent),
require such a format.

Note that this only works if we're using the application/json content
type.

Change-Id: I2d4a69347d013afc66d0473f54ab5ee991741f81

commit_message:
Enable optionally wrapping JSON requests to external checks

This adds a ``remote_json_wrapper_key`` configuration parameter, which
wraps the JSON document with the specified key.

If we configure this parameter to be "input" for instance, the request
will be:

{
    "input": {
        "rule": <the rule>,
        "target": <the target>,
        "credentials: <the credentials>
    }
}

This was done because some policy engines (such as Open Policy Agent),
require such a format.

Note that this only works if we're using the application/json content
type.

Change-Id: I2d4a69347d013afc66d0473f54ab5ee991741f81

'}, {'created': '2018-10-29 12:31:35.000000000', 'message': 'Handle JSON responses in the http and https checks

These json responses have the format of

{"result": true}

If this format is not followed, we then fall back to the format that has
been always checked (the 'True' string). This format is used by OPA
(Open Policy Agent)

Change-Id: Ie30906286b9d7d7309d124c8e7ade630ec2b5665

commit_message:
Handle JSON responses in the http and https checks

These json responses have the format of

{"result": true}

If this format is not followed, we then fall back to the format that has
been always checked (the 'True' string). This format is used by OPA
(Open Policy Agent)

Change-Id: Ie30906286b9d7d7309d124c8e7ade630ec2b5665

commit_message:
Fixup functions for 5.5.7+

Recent changes to Puppet (5.5.7+) has broken some of the legacy function
items we were doing in puppet-nova. We'll likely need to update all the
functions to the new syntax but for now this change is to address
current issues.

Change-Id: If1d675cec6fe64e8a812fb638078b0ab1c66b5de
Closes-Bug: #1799757
(cherry picked from commit 3d877926f09d9c0c0f331025256c4b55214c1269)
(cherry picked from commit 466230f3e20889a8c14a7c1361c03f4b961c6232)

commit_message:
Update parser functions to 4.x api

This change updates additional parser functions we have to use teh
puppet 4.x function api.  This includes some basic unit tests to ensure
they continue to function as expected.

Change-Id: Iebeb82b2890216bed139219441718fffc4004391
Related-Bug: #1799786

commit_message:
Update functions to fix unit tests

With the release of 5.5.7, some of the legacy function definitions no
longer pass in unit tests. This change updates the functions that are
failing in the tests to the modern style (4.x) for function
declarations.  Additionally we're removing teh lookup_hiera_hash
function which is failing but not actually consumed by our code base.

There will be a followup patch to migrate the rest of the parser
functions to the new format, but this patch should unblock the gates.

NOTE: git thinks some of these files have been added/deleted rather than
git move due to the large amount of changes between the two versions of
the file.

Change-Id: Ie7316fd422bd4a5eb91f94016977e5d8d76c27bc
Closes-Bug: #1799786

commit_message:
Always lowercase role name

Due to [1] ansible always access servers lowcase. Also, in respect to [2], this
patch lowercase name which is use in fqdn, hostname, ssh_known_hosts and other
places.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/26850/commits/aa4278e5f3ac2fc70c18ebd2f135378fa76776c7
[2] https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4343

Change-Id: Ib25832496d6504def436414b9c2903cbfe5854d4
Resolves: rhbz#1619556
(cherry picked from commit 0cf4bff9e67546e328e740edd69fcad16c60b699)

commit_message:
Pass stack name during minor update.

Overcloud minor update fails when stack's name differs.
To bypass it we need pass it to update commands.

Change-Id: Ia6a4792ff8f6214ed6ed87bd79e37266a3a995d5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-28 17:00:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add twine to global requirements

We have several jobs that run "python setup.py check -r -s" to validate
the repo's README file for issues that could cause PyPI upload failures.
This method is being deprecated with the new recommendation of running
"twine check" instead.

Is the library actively maintained?
    Yes - last release < 3 months ago, multiple releases per year

Is the library good code?
    Yes, maintained by the PyPa developers

Is the library python 3 compatible?
    Yes

Is the library license compatible?
    Yes - Apache 2 licensed

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?

    Yes, I see Ubuntu and Fedora packages

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

    No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

    Yes, for package description validation

Change-Id: Ifd77e1218b47fad42880377802336df7285274ac
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add twine to global requirements

We have several jobs that run "python setup.py check -r -s" to validate
the repo's README file for issues that could cause PyPI upload failures.
This method is being deprecated with the new recommendation of running
"twine check" instead.

Is the library actively maintained?
    Yes - last release < 3 months ago, multiple releases per year

Is the library good code?
    Yes, maintained by the PyPa developers

Is the library python 3 compatible?
    Yes

Is the library license compatible?
    Yes - Apache 2 licensed

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target (Ubuntu latest
/ Fedora latest)?

    Yes, I see Ubuntu and Fedora packages

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

    No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes, of course) Which?

    Yes, for package description validation

Change-Id: Ifd77e1218b47fad42880377802336df7285274ac
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
remove unmaintained vpnaas from all recipes and attributes

The vpnaas agent has been removed for the OpenStack Queens release.

Virtual Private Network-as-a-Service (VPNaaS) scenario
(for Rocky, no vpnaas docs found for Queens)
https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/rocky/admin/vpnaas-scenario.html

missing release note (or doc) on vpn-agent change in queens
https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1751069

vpnaas agent is removed since Queens and configuration changed
https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1781148

Change-Id: Idf74445445683058cd992e95df87724579e70433

commit_message:
Add ContainerImagePrepare to custom roles_data

New service ContainerImagePrepare, introduced in Rocky, triggers
a container image prepare in the same way as for the containerized
undercloud. When performing Q->R upgrade custom roles_data.yaml
has to be updated with it.

Change-Id: I11b4cc5697346e5729ab27c81bd0e3e86b92e7d0
(cherry picked from commit 4c28657ca910bf68dca492b4d9075643f3fcae3e)

commit_message:
fs050: upgrade the undercloud to Podman containers

For the containerized undercloud upgrade job, make it so during the
upgrade from Rocky, the undercloud is upgrades to Stein with Podman
containers and not Docker anymore.

Depends-On: I6831b4b952c95fde31febf8e14cb27cf22ff859b
Change-Id: I539fe73f6d82156b045fa0d45aad9529e98c0c2e

commit_message:
Function to apply workarounds

The workarounds can be either patches posted on review.openstack.org
 or arbitrary shell commands.
Below is an example of a workarounds:

---
pre_undercloud_upgrade_workaround:
  - BZ#xxxxxyz:
     patch: false
     basedir: ''
     id: ''
     command: 'touch /home/stack/pre_workaround_applied'
post_undercloud_deploy_workarounds:
  - BZ#xxxyyzz:
     patch: true
     basedir: '/usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/'
     id: 'xxxyyzz'
     command: ''

Change-Id: Id33c6d9c043433b395d4a4905a36820a18604860
(cherry picked from commit ed4cdcc9483ac4ea0d483d2493c5d04e73afe20e)

commit_message:
Add common vars to common plays

We should pass in the common vars to all the common plays in
deploy-steps.j2 so that tasks will have them available. Some of these
parameter driven variables were never actually wired up, so they didn't
work to begin with (such as enable_puppet/enable_debug).

Change-Id: I830e1ae21fe3e278a5f7591065d066c0a6883a9a
Closes-Bug: #1785635

* test_black_regex always takes list not a string and the list
  cancatenation is done with in the role itself that's why fs020

commit_message:
Fixed test_black_regex in FS020

* test_black_regex always takes list not a string and the list
  cancatenation is done with in the role itself that's why fs020
  is giving specified regex doesn't match with anything.

Change-Id: I2698e7708f9c4f836cf2aa9dc8706a6e6675e8ce

The OpenShift roles should include the OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm
service for Red Hat Subscription Management so that the provisioned
nodes can register with a Satellite or CDN.

commit_message:
Add OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm to OpenShift roles

The OpenShift roles should include the OS::TripleO::Services::Rhsm
service for Red Hat Subscription Management so that the provisioned
nodes can register with a Satellite or CDN.

Change-Id: I08862635c68eddbb0940863c43867ece1b289ee5
(cherry picked from commit a9f3874217ff073181006c20e6c4a8114426de37)

commit_message:
Force absolute path for CONFIG_VOLUME_PREFIX

When calling docker-puppet.py and passing it a relative path for
CONFIG_VOLUME_PREFIX, it is possible the path is understood as a named
volume instead of a path by docker. This commit ensures
config_volume_prefix is an absolute path.

Change-Id: Iccd89332be78ee7e83859bd272ae0f4a3ff31a0e
Closes-Bug: #1789189

commit_message:
Forward system logs to Monasca Log API

When Monasca is enabled disable direct logging to ElasticSearch and
send all logs harvested by Fluentd to the Monasca Log API.

This change also cleans up output files which may be left behind when
the various log forwarding options are enabled / disabled.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: I7197966c5117176407d60c86c08d3bcea5e8131a

[{'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-10-30 03:05:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-10-30 03:05:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-10-30 04:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-10-30 06:07:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-10-30 06:09:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-30 10:01:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hey Trinh, just want to make sure you saw this:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135088.html

We can still release searchlight and searchlight-ui, but we really would prefer to only do that if you know there is a need from a downstream consumer that will actually pick that up and do something with it.

I don't want to discourage this (awesome to see the progress in searchlight!) but we also want to make sure releases aren't being done that no one actually needs.

Going to put a -1 on here just to make sure it's seen that something is needed on this patch yet. You know your project and consumers better than us, so just let us know how you would like to proceed."}, {'account_id': 27068, 'date': '2018-10-30 12:11:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi Sean. Thank for reminding me. But, I did mention the link you give in the commit's message. The Searchlight team would like to do the release to evaluate our effort to revive the Searchlight projects."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-30 13:21:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

OK, sounds like a good enough reason. We can see for the later milestones whether it makes sense to continue to do this, but given the state of the project, it does seem like a good checkpoint. Thanks!'}]

commit_message:
Release Searchlight for the Stein-1 milestone

At the last vPTG, The Searchlight team decided to release
Searchlight using the cycle-with-milestones method [1] instead
of rc [2] to evaluate the effort to revive Searchlight project.

- searchlight: 6.0.0.0b1
- searchlight-ui: 6.0.0.0b1
- python-searchlightclient: 1.4.0

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/searchlight-stein-ptg
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135088.html

Change-Id: Ifd41933dcd801868b9735c5597aa5bba908d3c87
Signed-off-by: Trinh Nguyen <dangtrinhnt@gmail.com>

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/611665/4 : FAILURE in 2h 06m 26s'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:28:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Just dumping some context in here that was spread across other reviews:

The symptom we were seeing was in a patch above this one for the down-cell stuff, we would see a hard deadlock in a bunch of functional tests. Drilling down into things, I determined that we were blocking on taking the cell-switch lock in our test fixture for our single-process implementation of target_cell. That was blocking because the lock was already held, and we sit there until our cell timer times out in scatter_gather because we never get the lock. We were blocking another thread which already had that lock from getting a lock in oslo_db somewhere (i.e. a dining philosopher's arrangement). Thus, this patch to try to avoid holding the writer lock for all of the database stuff we need to do, and only hold it while we're switching the global state from one cell to another. It's potentially leaky, which is why I put the assertion to make sure the state doesn't get switched again, but it's only for functional tests and I have yet to observe a single time where that assertion was hit."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:38:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(3 comments)

Your logic is undeniable.

Nicely documented steps and I verified that what you doc-commented above is exactly what you're doing in the code.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-18 15:56:51.000000000', 'message': "Make CellDatabases fixture reentrant

The current CellDatabases fixture uses a single lock to protect code
that needs to run with the global database state pointed at a specific
cell. That is a problem if we ever need to recursively target a cell
(which would work in real life but not in tests), as wells as if we have
two threads that need to target a cell where other locks are involved
such that they deadlock each other.

This change attempts to convert the fixture to use the existing
writer lock to only protect the code that changes the global database
state, and a reader lock for all threads actually running code that
is targeted. This avoids the deadlock because the schedulable code that
could acquire other locks isn't blocking other threads, except those that
need to change to another cell.

Change-Id: I9cd701dea7356bd3825900e216b163b895299e08
"}, {'created': '2018-10-18 18:38:03.000000000', 'message': "Make CellDatabases fixture reentrant

The current CellDatabases fixture uses a single lock to protect code
that needs to run with the global database state pointed at a specific
cell. That is a problem if we ever need to recursively target a cell
(which would work in real life but not in tests), as wells as if we have
two threads that need to target a cell where other locks are involved
such that they deadlock each other.

This change attempts to convert the fixture to use the existing
writer lock to only protect the code that changes the global database
state, and a reader lock for all threads actually running code that
is targeted. This avoids the deadlock because the schedulable code that
could acquire other locks isn't blocking other threads, except those that
need to change to another cell.

Change-Id: I9cd701dea7356bd3825900e216b163b895299e08

commit_message:
Make CellDatabases fixture reentrant

The current CellDatabases fixture uses a single lock to protect code
that needs to run with the global database state pointed at a specific
cell. That is a problem if we ever need to recursively target a cell
(which would work in real life but not in tests), as well as when we have
two threads that need to target a cell where other locks are involved
such that they deadlock each other.

This change attempts to convert the fixture to use the existing
writer lock to only protect the code that changes the global database
state, and a reader lock for all threads actually running code that
is targeted. This avoids the deadlock because the schedulable code that
could acquire other locks isn't blocking other threads, except those that
need to change to another cell.

Change-Id: I9cd701dea7356bd3825900e216b163b895299e08

commit_message:
Add capabilities for privsep

CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE and CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH were added
(like in nova) to fix agents on kernel 4.15.
Please see bug for details

Change-Id: Ieed6f5f6906036cdeaf2c3d96350eeae9559c0c7
Closes-Bug: #1800157
(cherry picked from commit 32cc8b63d7bbe5cfc83b82a058d1c5832980f290)
