revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-26 03:39:08.000000000', 'message': "Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1
(cherry picked from commit 361669764fd28b4f6d5f1c6896624f2da4ff5151)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1
(cherry picked from commit 361669764fd28b4f6d5f1c6896624f2da4ff5151)

commit_message:
Add section about collecting feedback to PTL guide

Something I noticed when reaching out to projects conducting health
checks is that some needed feedback, but weren't sure where or how
to get it.

This adds a section in the PTL guide describing a few different ways
PTLs can go about collecting feedback from users and operators.

Change-Id: I501c1894b8799994daf21d1b44687dd0dd905eda

commit_message:
Apply Ansible strategy for rolling upgrade in Keystone

Add the `not_run_all` variable to Keystone handler tasks
to restart Keystone serices in serial nodes, which reduces
downtime.

The variable `serial_ratio` specifies the percentage of
hosts that will run in a batch. If `serial_ratio` is too
small, the task will be run consecutively on each host.

Depends-On: I4bcfc7ab58ed13e5cdae32396100a76bce28faf6
Change-Id: I7822abc34fa9b80e615560b095b272248fd28269
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

commit_message:
Remove test_obj argument from override_role function

In all cases of using override_role function the test_obj is same as
used for initializing the RbacUtils class, so test_obj argument is
redundant, because it can be memorize in self.test_obj variable.
Mark deprecated the RbacUtilsMixis.setup_rbac_utils function.

Change-Id: I432bec5967e4c3684bd3fd642997c355c8286426

commit_message:
Apply Ansible strategy for rolling upgrade in Ironic

Add the `not_run_all` variable to Ironic handler tasks
to restart Cinder serices in serial nodes, which reduces
the downtime.

The variable `serial_ratio` specifies the percentage of
hosts that will run in a batch. If `serial_ratio` is too
small, the task will be run consecutively on each host.

Depends-On: I4bcfc7ab58ed13e5cdae32396100a76bce28faf6
Change-Id: I625741efdee6f0fe175eafc5f4385afb46176a7f
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

commit_message:
Update repo_build role SHA for venv build fail fix

When creating the virtualenv, we would rather just
use the pip/setuptools packages already available on
the host, then upgrade them later. This helps keeps
the builds isolated to the versions we want, and
reduces outgoing requests which is important for
isolated builds.

This brings https://review.openstack.org/612640 into
the next stable/rocky release.

Change-Id: I3edb9c42dc370236ad131c1e68c76d2a52e6a7a7

The 'apt-get upgrade' does not set confdef and
confold currently, so an upgrade which requires
user input can break the cache build[1].

This patch updates the lxc_hosts role SHA to include
Ic6689387a28539b7eb341d55a9db08f078e8e975

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/733076/

Change-Id: I7a50a64a4759865bceccc6ae02132663c328172b
"}]
commit_message:
Update lxc_hosts role SHA for apt failures

The 'apt-get upgrade' does not set confdef and
confold currently, so an upgrade which requires
user input can break the cache build[1].

This patch updates the lxc_hosts role SHA to include
Ic6689387a28539b7eb341d55a9db08f078e8e975

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/raw/733076/

Change-Id: I7a50a64a4759865bceccc6ae02132663c328172b

commit_message:
Skip k8s installation if needed

Provide the user the ability to skip k8s installation in case user
provides her own k8s and etcd deployment.

Change-Id: Ief36778801720d5eb1d73cefbd6b00297b7241f1

commit_message:
Deprecate fping_path option

The config option fping_path is deprecated as of Rocky[1], we should
deprecate in puppet-nova.

[1]https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/rocky.html

Change-Id: Ic1f4ac65cce683618f772c4d3333f123938c0aea
Closes-Bug: #1794301
(cherry picked from commit 581d5dcb98344d8934d0a7e1f6c34e5ed9195b5c)

commit_message:
Fixup functions for 5.5.7+

Recent changes to Puppet (5.5.7+) has broken some of the legacy function
items we were doing in puppet-nova. We'll likely need to update all the
functions to the new syntax but for now this change is to address
current issues.

Change-Id: If1d675cec6fe64e8a812fb638078b0ab1c66b5de
Closes-Bug: #1799757
(cherry picked from commit 3d877926f09d9c0c0f331025256c4b55214c1269)

subject: Apply Ansible strategy for rolling upgrade in Nova
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-19 10:27:40.000000000', 'message': 'Apply Ansible stratefy for rolling upgrade in Nova

Add the `not_run_all` variable to Nova handler tasks
to restart Cinder serices in serial nodes, which reduces
the downtime.

The variable `serial_ratio` specifies the percentage of
hosts that will run in a batch. If `serial_ratio` is too
small, the task will be run consecutively on each host.

Depends-On: I4bcfc7ab58ed13e5cdae32396100a76bce28faf6
Change-Id: I845b10631a05150ad1897f361f244167eada1247
'}, {'created': '2018-10-30 10:12:49.000000000', 'message': 'Apply Ansible strategy for rolling upgrade in Nova

Add the `not_run_all` variable to Nova handler tasks
to restart Cinder serices in serial nodes, which reduces
the downtime.

The variable `serial_ratio` specifies the percentage of
hosts that will run in a batch. If `serial_ratio` is too
small, the task will be run consecutively on each host.

Depends-On: I4bcfc7ab58ed13e5cdae32396100a76bce28faf6
Change-Id: I845b10631a05150ad1897f361f244167eada1247
'}]
commit_message:
Apply Ansible strategy for rolling upgrade in Nova

Add the `not_run_all` variable to Nova handler tasks
to restart Cinder serices in serial nodes, which reduces
the downtime.

The variable `serial_ratio` specifies the percentage of
hosts that will run in a batch. If `serial_ratio` is too
small, the task will be run consecutively on each host.

Depends-On: I4bcfc7ab58ed13e5cdae32396100a76bce28faf6
Change-Id: I845b10631a05150ad1897f361f244167eada1247

commit_message:
Use int builtin filter for testing purpose

The haproxy validation was passing while it should fail.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: Id7ff957be0b1f2b9cc67b4db878ce70fdf8b9552
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2018-09-18 18:40:24.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use Accept.best_match

Accept.best_match has been deprecated, and acceptable_offers should be
used instead., starting in 1.8.x. Since the latter is not available in
1.7.x, we need to keep two different implementations.

Change-Id: Ida4ee116b870f8c673f6037f81a2695a8e4dde6d

used instead.

Change-Id: Ida4ee116b870f8c673f6037f81a2695a8e4dde6d
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use Accept.best_match

Accept.best_match has been deprecated, and acceptable_offers should be
used instead.

Change-Id: Ida4ee116b870f8c673f6037f81a2695a8e4dde6d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 18:21:28.000000000', 'message': 'Add tests for bug #1800511

In Rocky, we started including the MTU for networks all the time,
however this also meant that we started specifying the MTU when
doing live migrations.

It seems that the guest ABI changes when setting the MTU which
means that live migrations will fail.  This broke the live migration
of any instance that was launched prior to upgrading to Rocky, as
it was not loaded with the ABI having host_mtu specified.

This is a passing (negative) test-case which will include a follow
up patch that contains a fix and correcting tests.

Change-Id: Ia2fe50d727b1f83e808cb9dda3a55f853f048a3e

commit_message:
Add tests for bug #1800511

In Rocky, we started including the MTU for networks when vif_type
is bridge or tap and libvirt >= 3.3.0, however this also meant
that we started specifying the MTU when doing live migrations.

It seems that the guest ABI changes when setting the MTU which
means that live migrations will fail.  This broke the live migration
of any instance that was launched prior to upgrading to Rocky, as
it was not loaded with the ABI having host_mtu specified.

This is a passing (negative) test-case which will include a follow
up patch that contains a fix and correcting tests.

Related-Bug: #1800511
Change-Id: Ia2fe50d727b1f83e808cb9dda3a55f853f048a3e

commit_message:
Implement scope_type checking for credentials

This change adds tests cases for the default roles keystone
supports at install time. It also modifies the policies for the
credentials API to be more self-service by properly checking
for various scopes.

Closes-Bug: 1788415
Partial-Bug: 968696

Change-Id: Ifedb7798c96930b6cc0f91159a14a21ac4b02f9f

subject: Add constraint for nose in test requirements
messages:
[{'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-10-25 15:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-27 23:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-29 13:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Yhe current os-ken (and ryu) tests depend on nose, so this commit itlse is required.

On the other hand, nose has been in the maintenance mode for the past several years.
horizon hit false positive behavior of nose and horizon team has dropped the usage of nova.
Perhaps we need to clean up nose usage sooner or later.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:17:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27654, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:19:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > 
 > Yhe current os-ken (and ryu) tests depend on nose, so this commit
 > itlse is required.
 > 
 > On the other hand, nose has been in the maintenance mode for the
 > past several years.
 > horizon hit false positive behavior of nose and horizon team has
 > dropped the usage of nova.
 > Perhaps we need to clean up nose usage sooner or later.

Agree. Dropping nose is in the TODOs list.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-10-29 21:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-10-30 06:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-30 08:32:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

the webpage. This patch aims to make these images fit with the

commit_message:
Fix image fit width in Tacker doc

Currently, images in [1] is too wide compared to the horizontal of
the webpage. This patch aims to make these images fit with the
displaying site of webpage.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tacker/latest/user/dynamic_vnffg_usage_guide.html

Change-Id: I9ce12dfc9d2424e9e5b700c168b5a6a807dbea1d

[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-10-18 06:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-10-18 06:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-10-18 07:02:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-18 07:13:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

IMHO it's not big break of rules. "Train" name is related to the place where PTG was in fact so it's kind of geographical ;)'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-10-18 07:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

PTG attendees can certainly confirm trains were related to the location :) (and as mentioned already, the suggestion was already a popular one)'}, {'account_id': 23924, 'date': '2018-10-18 07:24:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2018-10-18 09:07:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-10-18 10:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-18 11:55:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review-1

Issue with the PTG link should probably be updated, but I am behind the idea to just pick Train as the release name.'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-10-18 12:44:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I think it’s a great proposal. Thanks Tony!'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:29:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25186, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-18 13:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

I support it being called Train, Bonus points for anyone who puts easter eggs in related to trains. The text does need to be updated though before it can be merged.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-18 16:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Sorry, I'm opposed to this idea.

I admit I don't understand the political framework, nor have I read the governing documents beyond [1], but that document makes it clear that this is supposed to be a community-wide vote.  Is it really legal for the TC (or whoever has merge rights on this) to merge a patch that gives that same body the power to take the decision out of the hands of the community? So it's really an oligarchy that gives its constituency the illusion of democracy until something comes up that it feels like not having a vote on? The fact that it's something relatively "unimportant" (this time) is not a comfort.

Not that I think the TC would necessarily move forward with this patch in the face of substantial opposition from non-TC "cores" or whatever.

I will vote enthusiastically for "Train". But a vote it should be.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/release-naming.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611511/'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-18 19:24:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm supportive, but I don't think it's fair that we get to decide on the name of the release.  Maybe we should just vote if it's okay to make an exception to allow "Train" to be part of the list and under go a vote (and really, it's probably gonna be Train anyways).

Also: it'd be good to talk to the foundation before we move forward, that name might not be allowed for X reason and all of this would be for no reason.'}, {'account_id': 6316, 'date': '2018-10-18 19:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Disenfranchising the electorate is always the wrong decision.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-18 20:17:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

I think we should stick to having the vote. That's what we do for these things and it is a way that people feel a "part of it". Arbitrarily choosing "Train" means that only people who were lucky enough to go Denver one of those times, and is in on the joke, is "cool". Let's not make "coolness" happen.

We should vote. If "Train" can't be on the list, we should look at the rules for what can be on the list and bend _those_, not bend having a vote.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-18 21:33:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from t-release-name to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-18 23:39:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

To my mind the point of the vote isn't to get the best name (if it was it's not working, because most of the names have been terrible); it's to have a name that the community feels like they chose. The TC picking the one we think they're most likely to want doesn't achieve the same purpose, even if the name chosen were the same (and we don't actually know it would be).

The naming process is well defined and already includes provision for the 'Waldon exception', so I don't see a need to short-circuit it. One of the reasons we set it up that way is to avoid length delays if legal or marketing (has anyone checked urban dictionary lately? don't.) nix the first choice(s) for whatever reason. FWIW I have no objection to adding Train to the poll, even though it doesn't meet the criteria (under the existing process the TC can approve that)."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-19 00:16:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Rollcall-Vote

Piling on, but +1 for allowing the name to be an option, but still something the community as a whole votes on.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-10-19 09:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-19 09:51:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

Thanks for the update, nits within.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-10-19 09:59:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:01:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (2 comments)
 > 
 > Thanks for the update, nits within.

Thanks Chris.  I think PS 3 addresses the issues.'}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:13:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2018-10-19 10:50:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2018-10-19 11:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-10-19 13:12:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

Agree adding "Train" to the list of options is a much better way to handle this:

- it allows to check that the community actually supports (or not) the inside joke proposal

- it gives us backup options in case the name fails to pass legal checks for some weird reason

- the whole point of the release naming is to have the community participate in choosing it'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-19 13:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

I can get on board with this.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-19 13:48:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:14:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Yay!'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:17:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:34:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2018-10-19 14:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-19 18:29:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-20 21:49:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-22 04:00:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

lgtm.'}, {'account_id': 23924, 'date': '2018-10-22 07:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-22 17:43:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 22629, 'date': '2018-10-23 09:02:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-10-24 08:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-10-24 11:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

See also the end of https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/queens-PTG-feedback and lines 59--66 of https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/ptg-future-and-ptg4-feedback'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:28:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

subject: Switch tempest plugins to stable/rocky release versions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Peña', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}, {'_account_id': 19648, 'name': 'SUSE Cloud CI', 'email': 'dmueller+suse-cloud-ci@suse.de', 'username': 'suse-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23735, 'name': 'sumitjami', 'email': 'sjamgade@suse.com', 'username': 'nthforloop'}]

[{'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-09-06 15:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-09-06 15:54:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-09-10 11:07:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-09-10 17:36:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-09-12 22:17:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:52:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 13:58:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:26:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 14:39:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-10-24 17:18:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

So this tempest-plugin release is a bit of hot mess. Take designate-tempest-plugin as an example, it is in both _independent (https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/deliverables/_independent/designate-tempest-plugin.yaml) and rocky (https://github.com/openstack/releases/blob/master/deliverables/rocky/designate-tempest-plugin.yaml). The one is rocky appear to by higher then the one in _independent. So my questions are: 1) Why is is in both _independent and rockey? Shouldn't it be in one or the other, but not both?, 2) Where's the *consistency*? Shouldn't openstack release management team fix this?, and 3) I would've expected tempest plugins to be aligned with tempest, which only have the *master* branch. If that's the case, wouldn't it make more sense to always use the master tarball?

Can we please sort out the above first?"}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 18:07:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

1) because it used to be independent until rocky when we did releases for the tempest plugins 2) the relationship between independent and release dependent isn't defined, I treat it as an unrelated release stream 3) we're locking the tempest version to the rocky release version of tempest:

https://releases.openstack.org/rocky/index.html

see the versions listed there, those are the ones we should be packaging imho."}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-24 18:07:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-10-24 18:26:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

> 1) because it used to be independent until rocky when we did
 > releases for the tempest plugins 2) the relationship between
 > independent and release dependent isn't defined, I treat it as an
 > unrelated release stream 3) we're locking the tempest version to
 > the rocky release version of tempest:
 > 
 > https://releases.openstack.org/rocky/index.html
 > 
 > see the versions listed there, those are the ones we should be
 > packaging imho.

Still confused. How does tempest do backports/cherrypicks if they don't have the stable branches? This certainly mean tempest will put out a new release in this case, which means we'll have to update all our branches. Which is a PITA, wouldn't it?"}, {'account_id': 23735, 'date': '2018-10-25 13:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

[   92s] The HTML pages are in build/sphinx/html.'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-10-26 14:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Published edit on patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2018-10-26 17:24:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: Code-Review+1

I still think pointing to master tarball is a better choice as tempest have no stable branch. Backporting bugs, when needed, may involving updating the stable branch to point to the latest tarball release, which is essentially the same as master.

But if we must follow the process, I don't have a problem with that either."}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-10-29 09:14:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-10-30 07:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow+1'}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-15 12:52:12.000000000', 'message': "Add requirements to test-requirements.txt

Without this change, in order to run the rpm status check you need to
figure out by trial and error what the script's dependencies are and
manually install them. With this change, running the script is as simple
as

 $ tox -evenv -- python tools/rpm-packaging-status.py $releases $rpmpackaging $requirements stein

Change-Id: I4dd6ca73d3522e5aeace2b9fd81cd8b39be755a0

commit_message:
Add requirements to test-requirements.txt

Without this change, in order to run the rpm status check you need to
figure out by trial and error what the script's dependencies are and
manually install them. With this change, running the script is as simple
as

 $ tox -evenv -- python tools/rpm-packaging-status.py $releases $rpmpackaging $requirements stein

Change-Id: I4dd6ca73d3522e5aeace2b9fd81cd8b39be755a0

commit_message:
Fix version parsing on python3

When run under python3, comparing a Version object with the string
obtained from parsing upper constraints caused a TypeError:

 TypeError: '>' not supported between instances of 'Version' and 'str'

This patch converts the upper constraints version number to a Version so
that it can be properly compared. It skips this if the string is '-'
because that means it is not in upper constraints.

Change-Id: Id1c97d42100cb973b856ecfbb8162ff30e94042d

[{'created': '2018-09-29 23:53:23.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4099b85b36164577f238001acd520e4322cf3d8e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4099b85b36164577f238001acd520e4322cf3d8e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 07:45:07.000000000', 'message': "Increase tempest jobs timeout

For jobs like:
- neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid
- neutron-tempest-linuxbridge
- neutron-tempest-dvr

Sometimes we hit timeouts which aren't related
directly to Neutron.

As was decided on Neutron CI meeting [1], lets try
to increase jobs' timeout to 3h and check if that
will help to stabilize those jobs.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2018/neutron_ci.2018-10-23-16.00.log.html#l-121

Change-Id: I24d694ba57aa3ff49f8c118486265925f1b4a611
(cherry picked from commit fb068f089c5cc0597c152f53b65cc246ac0a937b)
"}]
commit_message:
Increase tempest jobs timeout

For jobs like:
- neutron-tempest-iptables_hybrid
- neutron-tempest-linuxbridge
- neutron-tempest-dvr

Sometimes we hit timeouts which aren't related
directly to Neutron.

As was decided on Neutron CI meeting [1], lets try
to increase jobs' timeout to 3h and check if that
will help to stabilize those jobs.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2018/neutron_ci.2018-10-23-16.00.log.html#l-121

Change-Id: I24d694ba57aa3ff49f8c118486265925f1b4a611
(cherry picked from commit fb068f089c5cc0597c152f53b65cc246ac0a937b)

commit_message:
Fix ironic client ironic_url deprecation warning

In preparation for stein, use 'endpoint' instead of 'ironic_url'
when calling get_client in order to remove the following warning:

WARNING ironicclient.client The argument "ironic_url" passed to
get_client is deprecated and will be removed in Stein release,
please use "endpoint" instead.

For reference:
In the python-ironicclient code, in the ironicclient/client.py#L24
TODO(vdrok): remove in Stein
[...]
  ('ironic_url',): 'endpoint',

Introduced in commit:
https://github.com/openstack/python-ironicclient/commit/58c39b7a80583dd54165cf292ae5dc621e9da361

commit_message:
Update Keystone auth_url in vim_config.yaml

Currently, keystone_authtoken.auth_url is working at
`http://127.0.0.1/identity`, not `http://127.0.0.1:5000` as shown in
sample vim_config.yaml. So this patch aims to update the outdated
auth_url in vim_config.yaml file

Change-Id: I9e66ab5cd365c7bc70c80974fa891fc2e6ddd96f

commit_message:
Allow multiple keymasters

This allows the migration from one key provider to another.

Note that secret_id values must remain unique across all keymasters
in a given pipeline. If they are not unique, the right-most keymaster
will take precedence.

When looking for the active root secret, only the right-most keymaster
is used.

Change-Id: I6b5c812a54624f56c55164556385e3e475fb2470

commit_message:
Simplify the decryption of container listings

Following https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/4806434 there
is only one handler that might be used.

Following https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/2722e49 all
EncryptionException errors should be caught and handled in
decrypt_obj_dict.

Change-Id: Ib4e9db400a58853daa903ae0a625dfde47747552

commit_message:
Follow up s3api ensures any string for secret as bytes string

This is follow up for patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/605603
That looks fine, that enables s3api to take any string (unicode or bytes)
but no tests in the patch. This patch adds some tests (and test cleanups)
to asserts the logic works as expected.

Change-Id: I6368ba76ca2400482a35da3d407bb4903b578b41

subject: SSYNC: Stop sharing a global connection
messages:
[{'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2018-10-29 16:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2018-10-29 16:49:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This commit is just about preparing the ground for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613987/'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Sure; by the same reasoning as the parent patch (i.e., every sender that's instantiated is immediately called then thrown away), this must be exactly the same. I suppose the re-org also helps drive home the fact that the connection's lifetime it tied to just the one __call__.

 $ ack '[sS]ender\(' swift -A 1
 swift/obj/replicator.py:458:        return ssync_sender.Sender(
 swift/obj/replicator.py-459-            self, node, job, suffixes, remote_check_objs)()
 --
 swift/obj/reconstructor.py:823:            success, _ = ssync_sender(
 swift/obj/reconstructor.py-824-                self, node, job, suffixes)()
 --
 swift/obj/reconstructor.py:843:            success, in_sync_objs = ssync_sender(
 swift/obj/reconstructor.py-844-                self, node, job, job['suffixes'])()
 --
 swift/obj/ssync_sender.py:72:class Sender(object):
 swift/obj/ssync_sender.py-73-    """'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 16:46:03.000000000', 'message': 'SSYNC: Stop sharing a global connection

Change-Id: Id5988887f01532b27c3888a126764524d2466011
'}]

SSYNC: Stop sharing a global connection

Change-Id: Id5988887f01532b27c3888a126764524d2466011

subject: SSYNC: Remove useless self.failures in sender
messages:
[{'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2018-10-29 16:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13852, 'date': '2018-10-29 16:48:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This commit is just about preparing the ground for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/613987/'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:07:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Huh. Yep, looks pretty worthless at the moment:

 $ ack '\.failures' swift
 swift/obj/updater.py
 48:        self.failures = failures
 55:        return type(self)(self.errors, self.failures, self.quarantines,
 60:                          self.failures - other.failures,
 68:        self.failures = 0
 77:            (self.failures, 'failures'),
 328:             'failures': sweep_totals.failures,
 420:                self.stats.failures += 1
 
 swift/obj/ssync_sender.py
 101:        self.failures = 0
 136:                if not self.failures:
 
 swift/container/updater.py
 70:        self.failures = 0
 164:                    self.failures = 0
 174:                         'success': self.successes, 'fail': self.failures,
 200:        self.failures = 0
 209:             'fail': self.failures, 'no_change': self.no_changes})
 287:                self.failures += 1

Doesn't even seem to make sense in context at https://github.com/openstack/swift/commit/a80c720 ...

I'm starting to wonder why Sender is a class -- I guess to help organizationally? It looks like every time we instantiate one, we immediately call it and never hold on to a reference to the object... Maybe it'd be worth a static method to both instantiate and call? *shrug*"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 16:46:03.000000000', 'message': 'SSYNC: Remove useless self.failures in sender

Change-Id: Ie5264af0bf2a8d557489c597c3fdc5728e69c6e8
'}]

'}, {'created': '2018-03-26 22:57:38.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce floating IP pool resource

Add support for listing floating ip pools (subnets).
A new API resource ``floating_ips`` is introduced.
This API endpoint can return a list floating ip pools
which are essentially mappings between network UUIDs and
subnet CIDRs. Users can use this API to find out the pool
to create the floating IPs.

neutron-lib patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556674/

APIImpact add floatingip pools api
Change-Id: Iaa995630645042520df67d95271e14f11ffcff8c
Partial-Bug: #1653932
'}, {'created': '2018-04-09 17:17:34.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce floating IP pool resource

commit_message:
Introduce floating IP pool resource

Add support for listing floating ip pools (subnets).
A new API resource ``floatingip-pools`` is introduced.
This API endpoint can return a list floating ip pools
which are essentially mappings between network UUIDs and
subnet CIDRs. Users can use this API to find out the pool
to create the floating IPs.

Related patches:
* neutron-lib: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/556674/
* tempest-plugin: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562038/

APIImpact add floatingip pools api
Change-Id: Iaa995630645042520df67d95271e14f11ffcff8c
Partial-Bug: #1653932

commit_message:
Use context instead of manually setting the credentials for policy

This migrates from our minimal credentials dict, towards using
oslo.context directly (which is the recommended approach). In order to
do this, we had to change some policies to point towards the correct
attribute names.

Change-Id: If382e0a45497ffcc1d5b194c4244a59d2911afe6

commit_message:
set enable_v1_api=false in config sample

This is to avoid confusion as v1_api has been disabled by default
since d9f9579317bba03327af8c9c9eb3c6422eace1be

commit_message:
Port RuleDefaults to DocumentedRuleDefaults

In preparation for implementaing basic default roles[1] within
Barbican moving RuleDefault to DocumentedRuleDefault in policy
files.

Route to policy work being updated and tracked in wiki[2].

[1] -
https://github.com/openstack/keystone-specs/blob/master/specs/keystone/rocky/define-default-roles.rst
[2] - https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Barbican/Policy

Co-Authored-By: Juan Antonio Osorio Robles <jaosorior@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I73dd0cf8a89dc24a44b6bc2151d95df632932ccc

commit_message:
Add capabilities for privsep

CAP_DAC_OVERRIDE and CAP_DAC_READ_SEARCH were added
(like in nova) to fix agents on kernel 4.15.
Please see bug for details

Change-Id: Ieed6f5f6906036cdeaf2c3d96350eeae9559c0c7
Closes-Bug: #1800157
(cherry picked from commit 32cc8b63d7bbe5cfc83b82a058d1c5832980f290)

This updates the ceph-mon and ceph-osd charts to use the release
name for the hostpath defined for mounting the /var/log/ceph
directories to. This gives us a mechanism for creating unique log
directories for multiple releases of the same chart without the
need for specifying an override for each deployment of that chart

Change-Id: Ie6e05b99c32f24440fbade02d59c7bb14d8aa4c8
'}]
commit_message:
Ceph: Update log directory host mount path

This updates the ceph-mon and ceph-osd charts to use the release
name for the hostpath defined for mounting the /var/log/ceph
directories to. This gives us a mechanism for creating unique log
directories for multiple releases of the same chart without the
need for specifying an override for each deployment of that chart

Change-Id: Ie6e05b99c32f24440fbade02d59c7bb14d8aa4c8

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0347e869c56551b11003c497e7fba46676ef51e9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

That is my fault, sorry. I found we have to eliminate *long* cast even it's in PY2 block."}, {'account_id': 4608, 'date': '2018-10-29 10:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

[{'created': '2018-10-29 09:21:47.000000000', 'message': "Revert d935a9453dec60566d341387486eddc967e0ab9d

And then, use int() instead of long. if we leave the long()
cast anyway, it'll get failed with the syntax checker in python3
so that we have to avoid long() even it's in the six.PY2 block.

Change-Id: I62e5358ac82377089c038c1e320a46ad58ffbbcd
"}]
commit_message:
Revert d935a9453dec60566d341387486eddc967e0ab9d

And then, use int() instead of long. if we leave the long()
cast anyway, it'll get failed with the syntax checker in python3
so that we have to avoid long() even it's in the six.PY2 block.

Change-Id: I62e5358ac82377089c038c1e320a46ad58ffbbcd

commit_message:
Add noop to instack-undercloud

We'd like to remove instack-undercloud master but need to be able to
merge the retirement patch.

Change-Id: I14547fb67570d75d2e3f51379722a06d1d5f6100
Related-Blueprint: remove-instack-undercloud

commit_message:
Commit functional tests to stestr

Previously functional tests were using ostestr,
switch it to stestr.
According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is
maintained project to which all Openstack projects
should migrate.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Co-Authored-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin034@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I695e90415a23f4902ecbfc2424b23ff65608adbe
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-16 20:19:03.000000000', 'message': 'Update sphinx extension logging

Sphinx 1.6 deprecated using the application object to perform logging
and it will be removed in the upcoming 2.0 release. This updates our
extensions to use the recommended sphinx.util.logging instead.

Change-Id: I3b44e096c62a081e195ea22bc953d1752d7ff4b7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update sphinx extension logging

Sphinx 1.6 deprecated using the application object to perform logging
and it will be removed in the upcoming 2.0 release. This updates our
extensions to use the recommended sphinx.util.logging instead.

Change-Id: I3b44e096c62a081e195ea22bc953d1752d7ff4b7
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Drop legacy live migrate allocation compat code

This completes the legacy migration-based allocation
compat cleanup from I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92.
That change handled the cold migrate flows. This completes the
related cleanup for the live migrate flows.

The compat being removed here was added in change
I9068a5a5b47cef565802a6d58f37777464644100 in Queens.

Change-Id: I8e47cac8bab50a086b98f37c2f9f659b10009cf1

subject: Handle different endpoint format
messages: [{'account_id': 11536, 'date': '2018-10-23 03:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21428, 'date': '2018-10-30 04:11:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 03:39:31.000000000', 'message': 'Handle different endpoint format

Depending on a specific deployment of Zun, the API endpoint could
be of various formats. For example:

1. the classic (legacy) endpoint:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/v1/
2. under wsgi:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/container/v1
3. other:
    https://container.example.com/
    https://example.com/container

We need to parse the url correctly in order to get the correct version
URL which is used to determinate the API version.

Change-Id: Ia69959431e2d751d228f4cfc1db74b774bd9d69e
Closes-Bug: #1799343
'}]
commit_message:
Handle different endpoint format

Depending on a specific deployment of Zun, the API endpoint could
be of various formats. For example:

1. the classic (legacy) endpoint:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/v1/
2. under wsgi:
    http://{host}:{optional_port}/container/v1
3. other:
    https://container.example.com/
    https://example.com/container

We need to parse the url correctly in order to get the correct version
URL which is used to determinate the API version.

Change-Id: Ia69959431e2d751d228f4cfc1db74b774bd9d69e
Closes-Bug: #1799343

Can you help me understand if/how this impacts neutron plugins?


Do out-of-tree plugin projects need to be doing something to accommodate these upgrade checkers, or is that only necessary if they have their own checkers to add/run?'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-16 15:03:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 17120, 'date': '2018-10-16 15:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-16 15:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

> Can you help me understand if/how this impacts neutron plugins?
 > 
 > 
 > Do out-of-tree plugin projects need to be doing something to
 > accommodate these upgrade checkers, or is that only necessary if
 > they have their own checkers to add/run?

Basically it is community goal and should be accomplished by all OpenStack projects. I think that we maybe should try to add some mechanism (e.g. based on stevedore) to load also checks from 3rd party plugins/drivers.
Then such plugin could add own checks which would be loaded and run inside neutron-status cli.
I would like to know what others thing about such idea?'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-10-16 19:08:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Seems reasonable that stevedore plugins could be used.
I wonder if there'd be a need/means to order checks in case they need to be done in a specific sequence?"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-10-17 09:33:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Seems reasonable that stevedore plugins could be used.
 > I wonder if there'd be a need/means to order checks in case they
 > need to be done in a specific sequence?

I don't know yet. I will ask Matt about that but I think that for checks from N-1 to N there shouldn't be necessary to provide always same order of checks."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-17 10:44:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2018-10-17 11:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Just a note: if stevedore decided to be used for detecting networking projects checks, perhaps would be good to define in this patch the name of the entry point, to be consistent and a kind of plugin API to make it clear for those projects how to make their checks working.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-17 20:58:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I wonder if there'd be a need/means to order checks in case they need to be done in a specific sequence?

We've historically tried to make each check idempotent so they don't have interdependencies.

@boden: see https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/upgrade-checks.html for more details on these things."}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:25:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2018-10-18 04:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add neutron-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for neutron-status upgrade check commands.

For now it has only "check_nothing" check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/610061/

Change-Id: Ib08119e1bb8de80856edb6a39769d4bc9d98c587
Story: 2003657
Task: 26144

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-24 10:58:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I really like this cleanup, we need however to support the exactly same ability to set parameters.

IMO we should find a good way to move everything over to nova::vendordata, set the defaults in that class, set all other vendordata parameters in other places to undef then do a lot of pick()'s in nova::vendordata to make sure we collect the values from the correct places.

Otherwise we'll end up with duplicate definitions and a lot of dirty workaround everywhere.

The hard part here is since we have the parameters on multiple places to make sure it actually picks the correct value."}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-24 11:18:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

> I really like this cleanup, we need however to support the exactly
 > same ability to set parameters.
 > 
 > IMO we should find a good way to move everything over to
 > nova::vendordata, set the defaults in that class, set all other
 > vendordata parameters in other places to undef then do a lot of
 > pick()'s in nova::vendordata to make sure we collect the values
 > from the correct places.
 > 
 > Otherwise we'll end up with duplicate definitions and a lot of
 > dirty workaround everywhere.
 > 
 > The hard part here is since we have the parameters on multiple
 > places to make sure it actually picks the correct value.

That makes sense, thx!

Picking the right source should be easy with nova_metadata_wsgi_enabled
we have in nova::api:
true  -> nova::metadata
false -> nova::api

I'll work on this, stay tuned!"}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:27:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-24 15:30:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-10-24 16:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Martin, this is great! thanks!'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-10-24 17:25:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

Great stuff Martin, some feedback:

* If will be super ugly but could we get checks before executing any warning since those would always be shown even if a deployment is doing something wrong.

* Could we add TODO's everywhere where we now have code just to keep backward compatibility

* IMO we should add a lot of testing here to make sure all the previous ways is actually working since now we are only testing that the new approach, if this is suppose to be backported we strive towards being 110% sure we don't break any previous use case or cause duplicate defintion errors.

My -1 is not to the approach or the way it's done more that we need to document properly what we are suppose to get rid of late, and the point where we need to add a lot of testing to test that the old ways is still working. If other are OK with this I really don't have anything against it but would like to -1 to be noted about that.

Again, great work!"}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-25 07:58:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-25 07:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-25 09:16:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-25 09:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2018-10-25 16:22:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-10-25 20:35:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-24 09:39:32.000000000', 'message': 'Split off metadata vendordata plugin in own class

A recent change making nova-metadata-api work with wsgi [1] moved
the vendordata plugin parameters to the nova::metadata manifest.
While this is conceptually correct as nova-metadata is the one that
should be using this parameters. In practice the parameters are also
used in compute drivers (in the ironic driver, for instance), thats
why we should split them to be able to deploy nova-metadata-api
separate from nova-compute.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582621/

Change-Id: Ic3654c79d8cf275f0c58d57a4b66e2598450a7ed
Related-Bug: 1799352

commit_message:
Split off metadata vendordata plugin in own class

A recent change making nova-metadata-api work with wsgi [1] moved
the vendordata plugin parameters to the nova::metadata manifest.
While this is conceptually correct as nova-metadata is the one that
should be using this parameters. In practice the parameters are also
used in compute drivers (in the ironic driver, for instance), thats
why we should split them to be able to deploy nova-metadata-api
separate from nova-compute.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582621/

Change-Id: Ic3654c79d8cf275f0c58d57a4b66e2598450a7ed
Related-Bug: 1799352

messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-17 13:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-17 15:30:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-22 14:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8770, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 13:04:44.000000000', 'message': "Move warnings to their own module

Raising warnings from an exception module can result in a rather
confusing message:

  Running command: '/usr/bin/nova-scheduler '
  /.../sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py:332: NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not supported
    exception.NotSupportedWarning

For someone not used to Python's 'warning' infrastructure, this can look
worse than it is, as seen at [1].

While this particular warning was resolved in change I4a5f8958c3e, it's
possible that a similar warning could be raised for other options. Best
to move this out of the 'exception' module and into something more
sensible.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1639423

Change-Id: I8e0480fb11123067a111ed6aeda6b47614615645
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Move warnings to their own module

Raising warnings from an exception module can result in a rather
confusing message:

  Running command: '/usr/bin/nova-scheduler '
  /.../sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py:332: NotSupportedWarning: Configuration option(s) ['use_tpool'] not supported
    exception.NotSupportedWarning

For someone not used to Python's 'warning' infrastructure, this can look
worse than it is, as seen at [1].

While this particular warning was resolved in change I4a5f8958c3e, it's
possible that a similar warning could be raised for other options. Best
to move this out of the 'exception' module and into something more
sensible.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1639423

Change-Id: I8e0480fb11123067a111ed6aeda6b47614615645
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Migration step to update objects to latest version

This adds a migration step that will be executed as the last step
in the 'ironic-dbsync online_data_migration' command. It updates
all the objects that aren't in their latest version, to be in
their latest version.

Conflicts:
	ironic/cmd/dbsync.py
	ironic/db/api.py
	ironic/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
	ironic/tests/unit/db/test_api.py

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib39319a75205ce7692f0525f99200a5de3d60a88
Story: #2004174
Task: #27656
(cherry picked from commit b8d0f2b091fe88b42ac4d0b352fd54423c5a3e2c)

commit_message:
Add support for certs relation

Add support for rabbitmq using the certificates relation
to secure traffic with clients. Support for users supplying
their own certs and for rabbit acting as its own Certificate
Authority should be unchanged. The follwoing additional changes
were needed:

* Charm helper sync
* Update rabbit to use get_relation_ip from charm helpers which
  is the standard helper for calculating endpoint ip addresses.
* Create network helpers file to avoid circular dependancies.

Change-Id: Ie60893e660efe1f8b0a0d42aaaecfbd9aae6f97c

commit_message:
Add cyborg-status upgrade check command framework

This adds basic framework for cyborg-status upgrade
check commands. For now it has only "check_placeholder"
check implemented.
Real checks can be added to this tool in the future.

Change-Id: I4a180f9a1b25c75489ad3cfee30a7b55506e0bbd
Story: 2003657
Task: 26126

[docs] Deploy cyborg api under WSGI server

This patch adds the docs for deploying cyborg api under WSGI server
and fixes a few small mistakes.

Not a big deal for master, since we haven't released anything yet. So upgrading from master will be fine :) The 'critical' is for the backport; it is critical for queen & rocky. Otherwise, may not be able to upgrade from queen to rocky; or rocky to stein.

Thx for reviewing!"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-10-29 10:58:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck TimeoutException in mysql unit tests'}]

commit_message:
Migration step to update objects to latest version

This adds a migration step that will be executed as the last step
in the 'ironic-dbsync online_data_migration' command. It updates
all the objects that aren't in their latest version, to be in
their latest version.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib39319a75205ce7692f0525f99200a5de3d60a88
Story: #2004174
Task: #27656

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-24 11:27:41.000000000', 'message': 'PY3: Ensure rados.Object.read/write use byte data

rados.Object.write(string_to_write) [1] and rados.Ioctx.write(data) [2]
expect to write byte data for the above named arguments.
rados.Object.read() returns that data.

Ensure that the json_meta argument passed to rados.Object.write() in
VolumeMetadataBackup.set() is encoded as a UTF-8 bytes object and decoded
after rados.Object.read().

Also update the corresponding unit tests to ensure that metadata
dictionaries are JSON serialized, encoded, and decoded similar to
how the actual code behaves. [3]

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L3984
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L2641
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798917/comments/4

Change-Id: Idb225b5c84be3beac0c272ed4b8d69ebb04c5858
Closes-Bug: #1798917
'}]
commit_message:
PY3: Ensure rados.Object.read/write use byte data

rados.Object.write(string_to_write) [1] and rados.Ioctx.write(data) [2]
expect to write byte data for the above named arguments.
rados.Object.read() returns that data.

Ensure that the json_meta argument passed to rados.Object.write() in
VolumeMetadataBackup.set() is encoded as a UTF-8 bytes object and decoded
after rados.Object.read().

Also update the corresponding unit tests to ensure that metadata
dictionaries are JSON serialized, encoded, and decoded similar to
how the actual code behaves. [3]

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L3984
[2] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/blob/v13.2.1/src/pybind/rados/rados.pyx#L2641
[3] https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1798917/comments/4

Change-Id: Idb225b5c84be3beac0c272ed4b8d69ebb04c5858
Closes-Bug: #1798917

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-04 21:53:25.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Enable versioned nova notifications

Listen for versioned notifications from Nova servers.

For now, the default nova configuration will send notifications to both
the versioned and unversioned topics, and searchlight will receive them
I think because of the way the RMQ binding works, even though the topics
are different (other nova plugins are bound to the unversioned
notifications).

To test this properly, alter the nova configuration to use only versioned
notifications. Edit nova.conf, and then restart nova API and scheduler:

  [notifications]
  notification_format: versioned

Also the versioned notifications are not entirely compatible with the
API or the old notifications; mostly notably in the network information.

Implements blueprint: nova-versioned-notifications

Change-Id: Iea3c2f19cca4b24f05b7edab4b307555fecdc1b3
'}, {'created': '2017-04-12 20:22:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Enable versioned nova notifications

Listen for versioned notifications from Nova servers.

For now, the default nova configuration will send notifications to both
the versioned and unversioned topics. The default for searchlight is now
to ignore the unversioned notifications but this can be controlled by

  [resource_plugin:os_nova_server]
  use_versioned_notifications = true
  notification_maj_version = 1
  notification_min_version = 3

Also the versioned notifications are not entirely compatible with the
API or the old notifications; mostly notably in the network information.

Still needs tests but otherwise working.

Implements blueprint: nova-versioned-notifications

Change-Id: Iea3c2f19cca4b24f05b7edab4b307555fecdc1b3
'}, {'created': '2017-04-12 20:51:44.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Enable versioned nova notifications

"}, {'created': '2017-07-05 16:22:37.000000000', 'message': "Enable versioned nova notifications

Listen for versioned notifications from Nova servers. The expected
versions for each type are coded into notification_handlers.

The versioned notifications are not entirely compatible with the
API or the old notifications; mostly notably in the network information.

This patch merges some fields where the notification names are different
from the API (e.g. removal of OS-EXT prefixes). It also updates some
recent admin only fields.

Needs some functional tests but i'm tempted to add that in a later
patch.

Implements blueprint: nova-versioned-notifications

Change-Id: Iea3c2f19cca4b24f05b7edab4b307555fecdc1b3

commit_message:
Enable versioned nova notifications

Listen for versioned notifications from Nova servers. The expected
versions for each type are coded into notification_handlers.

The versioned notifications are not entirely compatible with the
API or the old notifications; mostly notably in the network information.

Needs some functional tests as well

Change-Id: Iea3c2f19cca4b24f05b7edab4b307555fecdc1b3
Signed-off-by: Steve McLellan <steven.j.mclellan@gmail.com>
Story: #2003676
Task: #26198

Please use curl command as follows:
curl -s -X PATCH -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json"\
  -d '[{
    	"path": "/program",
    	"op": "replace",
    	"value": [{
    		"image_uuid": "{image_uuid}"
    	}]
  }]'\
  http://{host_ip}:6666/v1/accelerators/deployables/{deployable_uuid}/program

Change-Id: I70ff5edac65fe9e9ec1783d62c2ecd21ac5fab18
'}, {'created': '2018-10-27 15:10:03.000000000', 'message': 'Added downloading bitstream when programming fpga

How to test the flow of program process manually:
1. generate the fake env by the follow command
cat > ./fake_env.sh << EOL
SYSINFO=cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/sysinfo.py
UTILS=cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/utils.py
sed -i -e 's/^\(SYS_FPGA\) = "\(\/sys\/class\/fpga\)"$/\1 = "\/tmp\2"/g' $SYSINFO
sed -i -e 's/^\(SYS_FPGA_PATH\) = "\(\/sys\/class\/fpga\)"$/\1 = "\/tmp\2"/g' $UTILS
python cyborg/tests/unit/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/prepare_test_data.py
LOG=/tmp/intel_fpga_program.log
sudo echo 'echo fpgaconf \$@ '"|tee $LOG" > /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo echo "date |tee -a $LOG" >> /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo echo "echo 'Program intel FPGA successfully' |tee -a $LOG" >> /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo chmod a+x /usr/bin/fpgaconf
EOL

chmod a+x ./fake_env.sh
sudo ./fake_env.sh

2. Please use curl command as follows:
curl -s -X PATCH -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json"\
  -d '[{
    	"path": "/program",
    	"op": "replace",
    	"value": [{
    		"image_uuid": "{image_uuid}"
    	}]
  }]'\
  http://{host_ip}:6666/v1/accelerators/deployables/{deployable_uuid}/program

3. Checke the /tmp/intel_fpga_program.log it should see the infomation as
the follow exmaple:
$ cat /tmp/intel_fpga_program.log
fpgaconf -b 04 -d 00 -f 1 4047d422-5d2f-432c-b87f-5e1749e95ee6.bin
Sat Oct 27 15:08:34 UTC 2018
Program intel FPGA successfully

Change-Id: I70ff5edac65fe9e9ec1783d62c2ecd21ac5fab18

commit_message:
Added downloading bitstream when programming fpga

How to test the flow of program process manually:
1. generate the fake env by the follow command
cat > ./fake_env.sh << EOL
SYSINFO=cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/sysinfo.py
UTILS=cyborg/accelerator/drivers/fpga/utils.py
sed -i -e 's/^\(SYS_FPGA\) = "\(\/sys\/class\/fpga\)"$/\1 = "\/tmp\2"/g' $SYSINFO
sed -i -e 's/^\(SYS_FPGA_PATH\) = "\(\/sys\/class\/fpga\)"$/\1 = "\/tmp\2"/g' $UTILS
python cyborg/tests/unit/accelerator/drivers/fpga/intel/prepare_test_data.py
LOG=/tmp/intel_fpga_program.log
sudo echo 'echo fpgaconf \$@ '"|tee $LOG" > /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo echo "date |tee -a $LOG" >> /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo echo "echo 'Program intel FPGA successfully' |tee -a $LOG" >> /usr/bin/fpgaconf
sudo chmod a+x /usr/bin/fpgaconf
EOL

chmod a+x ./fake_env.sh
sudo ./fake_env.sh

2. Please use curl command as follows:
curl -s -X PATCH -H "X-Auth-Token: $OS_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json"\
  -d '[{
    	"path": "/program",
    	"op": "replace",
    	"value": [{
    		"image_uuid": "{image_uuid}"
    	}]
  }]'\
  http://{host_ip}:6666/v1/accelerators/deployables/{deployable_uuid}/program

3. Checke the /tmp/intel_fpga_program.log it should see the infomation as
the follow exmaple:
$ cat /tmp/intel_fpga_program.log
fpgaconf -b 04 -d 00 -f 1 4047d422-5d2f-432c-b87f-5e1749e95ee6.bin
Sat Oct 27 15:08:34 UTC 2018
Program intel FPGA successfully

Change-Id: I70ff5edac65fe9e9ec1783d62c2ecd21ac5fab18

commit_message:
New Repo: OpenStack-Helm Docs

This PS adds a new repo for the OpenStack-Helm project. This
repo will house the documentation that is currently spread
throughout the openstack-helm, openstack-helm-addons and
openstack-helm-infra repos.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/611893/
Change-Id: I14dca9b2b8cf68ca4ef058e19a5ee673a13bbf76
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Migration step to update objects to latest version

This adds a migration step that will be executed as the last step
in the 'ironic-dbsync online_data_migration' command. It updates
all the objects that aren't in their latest version, to be in
their latest version.

Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Tantsur <dtantsur@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib39319a75205ce7692f0525f99200a5de3d60a88
Story: #2004174
Task: #27656
(cherry picked from commit b8d0f2b091fe88b42ac4d0b352fd54423c5a3e2c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-26 03:35:22.000000000', 'message': "Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1
(cherry picked from commit 361669764fd28b4f6d5f1c6896624f2da4ff5151)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not access the connection's socket during error callback

The _get_connection_info() method attempts to gather debug information
from the connection, and will reach into the amqp channel to get the
local (client's) TCP port number via the 'sock' property.

If _get_connection_info() is called from autoretry's on_error handler
the 'sock' property notices that the transport is not set and attempts
to re-connect.  amqp has deprecated this reconnect behavior, and in
any case the client's socket is irrelevant since the connection may
not be valid at this point.

Closes-Bug: #1745166
Change-Id: I3c42f8463605927f6f94d6c3a7f05e584476abc1
(cherry picked from commit 361669764fd28b4f6d5f1c6896624f2da4ff5151)

commit_message:
Incremental backup completion in RBD driver

This spec proposes completely supporting incremental backup
in RBD. If the incremental flag '--incremental' is not specified,
then a new full backup will always be created.

Change-Id: Ib111e2a321db291d22ae4ab4893c3d0e0745d334
blueprint: rbd-incremental-backup-improvement

commit_message:
Fix provisioning in agent when ['instance_info']['capabilities'] is unicode.

This patch introduces an extra check if ['capabilities'] are a unicode dict
and converts it to dict, before assigning the ['boot_option'] = 'local'

Change-Id: Ibaa01e04cb84d880760d239db0dc18e35b15360d
Story: 2004189

commit_message:
Correct documentation hyperlink for environment-markers

Previous hyperlink was redirected to root of the new documentation
location which did not contain the right information.

New link points directly to the right location.

Change-Id: I3c83553a50036eadec74e7a00f3b312a7e5afa11

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-01 16:11:15.000000000', 'message': "WIP: emit_release outputs dlrn_hash_tag_newest as well for upgrade.

WIP: adjusting the bare minimum to get the standalone working, as
adjusting for this missing variable will require a significant amount
of work especially in the unit testing part.  I'll do it if that
solution works fine.

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which
becomes delorean url.  We don't do anything about dlrn_hash_tag_newest
which becomes RDO_DLRN_REPO which becomes delorean-current.

This mean that when we are upgrading we get the dlrn_hash_tag_newest
that was defined in the previous run, ie during deployment.

Change-Id: I0e298fc37eb7b3fd0afaa13ab021330b789b2f5e

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which

Change-Id: I0e298fc37eb7b3fd0afaa13ab021330b789b2f5e
"}, {'created': '2018-10-05 15:33:06.000000000', 'message': "Add standalone upgrade to emit release.

This also add dlrn_hash_newest variable to be able to make proper repo
switching.

The $title is just adding the necessary bits into emit_release to take
standalone_upgrade into account.

The dlrn_hash_newest is a forgotten variable from the initial emit
release.  It has been included for standalone upgrade where the
problem first appeared, but will likely be needed for other upgrade
jobs as well when they switch to non specific release file.

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which
becomes delorean url. We don't do anything about dlrn_hash_tag_newest
which becomes RDO_DLRN_REPO which becomes delorean-current.

This means that when we are upgrading we get the dlrn_hash_tag_newest
that was defined in the previous run, ie during deployment.

Change-Id: I0e298fc37eb7b3fd0afaa13ab021330b789b2f5e
Closes-Bug: #1795367
"}, {'created': '2018-10-11 13:28:36.000000000', 'message': "Add standalone upgrade to emit release.

problem first appeared, but will likely be needed for other upgrade
jobs as well when they switch to non specific release file.

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which
becomes delorean url. We don't do anything about dlrn_hash_tag_newest
which becomes RDO_DLRN_REPO which becomes delorean-current.

This means that when we are upgrading we get the dlrn_hash_tag_newest
that was defined in the previous run, ie during deployment.

Change-Id: I0e298fc37eb7b3fd0afaa13ab021330b789b2f5e
Closes-Bug: #1795367

commit_message:
Add standalone upgrade to emit release.

This also add dlrn_hash_newest variable to be able to make proper repo
switching.

The $title is just adding the necessary bits into emit_release to take
standalone_upgrade into account.

The dlrn_hash_newest is a forgotten variable from the initial emit
release.  It has been included for standalone upgrade where the
problem first appeared, but will likely be needed for other upgrade
jobs as well when they switch to non specific release file.

Currently we only set dlrn_hash which becomes TRIPLEO_DLRN_REPO which
becomes delorean url. We don't do anything about dlrn_hash_tag_newest
which becomes RDO_DLRN_REPO which becomes delorean-current.

This means that when we are upgrading we get the dlrn_hash_tag_newest
that was defined in the previous run, ie during deployment.

Change-Id: I0e298fc37eb7b3fd0afaa13ab021330b789b2f5e
Closes-Bug: #1795367

commit_message:
Fix type of --config-download-timeout

This arg should be of type int, not the default type string.

Change-Id: If828292df20bba370791dcb9736fa44b40b3e94c
Closes-Bug: #1799241
(cherry picked from commit 2dc6920e8b498c190344e0337d7a782efbd3de6b)

commit_message:
Use container_build_id for standalone containers

The container_build_id is set by the container-prep role with multiple
fallbacks, we have to use the same value for the
standalone-container-prep.sh tag value

Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/251?kanban-status=1447276

Change-Id: I908d5d8d218e49f3ae3c2d4cf89295ce2d260004

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-22 18:14:48.000000000', 'message': "Change log directory for OpenDaylight

OpenDaylight karaf logs are currently stored in
/var/log/containers/opendaylight/karaf.log.

There is a logrotate_crond container job, that will
rotate any *.log in /var/log/containers, with this
pattern:

/var/log/containers/*/*log /var/log/containers/*/*/*log {
  daily
 ....
}

OpenDaylight is Java code, and has it's own logrotate
mechanism alreay configured. Currently, we have 2 entities
doing log rotation, tripleO logrotate_crond, and ODL Pax
logging. These 2 don't play nicely together.

This patch will move the ODL logs out of the path
of the tripleO log rotate cron job, so that ODL can
manage it's own log rotation.

Another option would be to modify tripleO to explicitly
list out all of the containers, and only do log rotation
for those listed.

Closes-Bug:#1793566

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1793566

Change-Id: I8acf7db248bf31d3010bc0313f48812a244d1004
Signed-off-by: Victor Pickard <vpickard@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d520016ff827fb309a5935c2c7189bb5a2bc4bf1)
"}]
commit_message:
Change log directory for OpenDaylight

OpenDaylight karaf logs are currently stored in
/var/log/containers/opendaylight/karaf.log.

There is a logrotate_crond container job, that will
rotate any *.log in /var/log/containers, with this
pattern:

/var/log/containers/*/*log /var/log/containers/*/*/*log {
  daily
 ....
}

OpenDaylight is Java code, and has it's own logrotate
mechanism alreay configured. Currently, we have 2 entities
doing log rotation, tripleO logrotate_crond, and ODL Pax
logging. These 2 don't play nicely together.

This patch will move the ODL logs out of the path
of the tripleO log rotate cron job, so that ODL can
manage it's own log rotation.

Another option would be to modify tripleO to explicitly
list out all of the containers, and only do log rotation
for those listed.

Closes-Bug:#1793566

https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1793566

Change-Id: I8acf7db248bf31d3010bc0313f48812a244d1004
Signed-off-by: Victor Pickard <vpickard@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d520016ff827fb309a5935c2c7189bb5a2bc4bf1)

commit_message:
Parametrize OpenShift deployment type

This prevents hardcoding it in the template and allows to check for the
right service name during new node detection as origin and
openshift-enterprise deployment types use differnt prefixes for the
services.

Change-Id: Id5cf7d6f7888b759eec7c969275fe15779b7b775

commit_message:
Don't install setuptools/pip/virtualenv from RPMs

Openstack infra has them already installed and we are not supose to
install it, for example at fedora the exclude them explitcitly from the
dnf.conf

Change-Id: I3b276e159ff7534777219975995fc20c967d0e42
Store: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/248?kanban-status=1447275

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 19:52:19.000000000', 'message': '[queens-only] include local_ip & undercloud_admin_host in docker_insecure_registries

This patch includes by default the local_ip and undercloud_admin_host in
docker_insecure_registries parameter, that can be missed but actually
needed in some cases.

This code was done in tripleoclient for the containerized undercloud in
Rocky, so we just need to port it here for stable versions, to have the
same behavior.

commit_message:
[queens-only] include local_ip & undercloud_admin_host in docker_insecure_registries

This patch includes by default the local_ip and undercloud_admin_host in
docker_insecure_registries parameter, that can be missed but actually
needed in some cases.

This code was done in tripleoclient for the containerized undercloud in
Rocky, so we just need to port it here for stable versions, to have the
same behavior.

Change-Id: I03be8381ec776fd769139c79b85470acedc64d2b
Closes-Bug: #1799784

* When Moving 'stackviz to /var/log/extra/stackviz' task is called,
  /var/log/extra/stackviz directory does not exist which leads to
  failure giving no such directory in order to fix that we need
  to check whether destination exists or not. If not first create
  it and then move the content and also make sure stackviz-export
  operation has successfully completed.

commit_message:
Fixed stackviz report for standalone

* When Moving 'stackviz to /var/log/extra/stackviz' task is called,
  /var/log/extra/stackviz directory does not exist which leads to
  failure giving no such directory in order to fix that we need
  to check whether destination exists or not. If not first create
  it and then move the content and also make sure stackviz-export
  operation has successfully completed.

Change-Id: Ie84c150c74363da25e76bbb234a864a72c6c366a

Hi Vipin,

The idea of validating the types is very good! I'm just concerned about the addition of a new API and new command to admins' command list. This seems to be the thing that will be forgotten and people will usually fall on the usual behavior (i.e. create a type and only see the error when creating a volume). So, my opinion is that we implement that in the create/update type flow so the checking is transparent to the admins. Also, it seems that the create/update requests should be routed to the scheduler that will have updated stat information from all backends."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2016-11-01 13:44:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add sphinx extension to document policies/profiles

This change adds a sphinx extention to build sections of the policy and
profile documentation from source code.

- Add new extension
- Modify contributor documentation for policies to show spec fields
  from source code
- Modify user documentation for policies and profiles to show properties
  from source code
- Modify user documentation for policies and profiles to include
  samples extracted from examples directory
- Update tox to run pep8 against sphinx extension

Change-Id: I32f68867d14c3288385dbdf3b4df14e8ca2fd01f
